Leidos is actively exploring the use of artificial intelligence and machine learning to further improve the AirShield system. These technologies can improve the system's ability to adapt and make independent decisions under complex combat conditions. An important aspect of AirShield's development is ensuring its resistance to cyber attacks, for which both offensive and defensive strategies are being developed. This project continues Leidos' work on C-UAS systems initiated by the US Defense Advanced Projects Agency's Mobile Force Protection (MFP) program (DARPA). After a successful demonstration, the program was transferred to the Air and Missile Development Center of the US Army Combat Capabilities Command (DEVCOM). Leidos plans to begin production of the AirShield in 2025, with initial deployment expected to the US Southern Command (SOUTHCOM), which will be a significant advance for this innovative technology. As note analysts of the defense portal Army Recognition, the development of the AirShield system by Leidos is crucial due to the rapid growth of threats posed by unmanned aerial vehicles aerial systems (UAVs). As the use of drones for military operations and hostilities increases, the need for an effective and adaptive defense response becomes critical. AirShield is not only designed to protect military and civilian facilities from potential drone incursions, but also to provide an integrated solution that can adapt to new technologies and combat tactics. This positions Leidos as a leader in a growing market where air safety is a top priority. In addition, as geopolitical conflicts escalate and asymmetric threats grow, countries are looking for ways to protect their critical infrastructure and armed forces. As a versatile air defense system, AirShield offers real-time threat detection, tracking and neutralization capabilities that are vital to maintaining operational superiority. By integrating advanced technologies such as artificial intelligence and various effectors, Leidos positions its system as an important response to the complex security environment, thereby helping to protect the strategic interests of its customers. At the international level, US allies that have problems with enemy UAVs, especially those participating in coalition operations, have expressed interest in acquiring such advanced C-UAS systems to strengthen their air defense capabilities. However, specific details about other foreign military forces interested in the AirShield system may not be publicly available at this time. AirShield is an advanced anti-drone system. Video: Leidos

Title: Winter is near. We check dugouts, prepare firewood and pet cats together with soldiers of the 44th O...
Description: ArmyInform visited the soldiers of 44 separate mechanized brigades, who are fighting in one of the hot areas, to ask how they prepare for winter and adjust their life in conditions of constant danger of airstrikes. Do the dugouts leak, how much do mice interfere, how to wash in the field and how much firewood should be prepared for the winter - you will find out in the ArmyInform photo report below. We start our conversation in the field kitchen - this is where they gather to talk about life, to pet cats and dogs that nail themselves to positions, and to prepare food and even wash their hair. Recently, the soldiers insulated it for the winter - oilcloth around the perimeter was enough, because the -burzuyka- heats here almost 24 hours a day. There is an entrance to the dugout from the kitchen, which additionally makes it warmer and more protected. - The dugout was made by those who live here. There are five of us. Well, did Oleg -move- because he stayed in the forest alone in his dugout. He moved to live with us, the boys say. When asked if water does not flow from the kitchen down to the dugout during rains or when the snow melts, they explain that once it could collect at the entrance, but everything was still dry and warm below. At the beginning of the day, a bucket with water is left on the stove, it can stand like this all day long - so that, on occasion, someone who needs it can wash his head or take water for a trip to the bath. We go down from the kitchen to the dugout. From the conversation, it is felt that the guys made a good effort when they built their -housing-: the height here is about 2.3 meters, then there is a 50 cm -roll- and the ground. They show -heating- - the volume that can be placed under one -bunch- is enough for the winter. They say that there are stocks and they have time to chop more firewood. The immediate answer to the question of who is cutting down is everyone who lives. They do it when they are in the mood: -You know, sometimes you want to physically do something. So you take an ax and go chop wood.- They emphasize that they do not do any exceptional things about the dugout on the eve of winter, because it is already warm. Unless you often have to open the door to ventilate, but in general you can breathe normally. — The main thing is to periodically clean the pipe of the -burzuika- from soot. We clean once a week, because we smoke intensively in winter, - they explain. — We sleep in thermal baths, in the winter the -burzhujika- may take a little more firewood. But we did everything in such a way that on the eve of winter there is no need to prepare anything in particular, - says the soldier Valeriy. To avoid leaks, oilcloth is used everywhere. In general, this is a very useful thing in everyday life - it is also used to insulate the toilet and bath. All the remaining gaps are blown with mounting foam, which also helps retain heat. We ask the -Artist- about some features of everyday life that are not found in other of their peers. He immediately shows us a kitchen cabinet, which was made from a box from BC, as well as a -mashed- for potatoes with a grenade tip. Next, -Bob- picks us up - takes us outside and shows us an improvised refrigerator. At first glance, it's just a BC box stuck in the ground, but it's not. The technology, until the frosts hit, is as follows: the box is buried in the ground and the inside is decorated with a foil lining, which should keep the temperature. But in order to ensure the minimum temperature inside, bottles of frozen water are needed - the guys -order- them in advance at the store, and take them when they manage to go to the city. This is not all of the -chips- in these positions. Oleg and I leave the kitchen to see what the boys themselves say - -take a picture, because they won't believe it.- Indeed, it is hard to believe, but at the end of October, tomatoes grow here. The fighters do not know who planted them here and how, but nevertheless they tied up these tomatoes and visit from time to time to check if they have not withered. When asked whether it is realistic to harvest from this bush, he shakes his head in denial, but adds with a smile that the point is not to eat that tomato, but to take care of it as long as it is physically possible. The problem with electricity is solved by the battery, which was hidden under the -hole- in the dugout. A simple one, from a car, is enough for about a week. Guys have two of these: while one is working, the other is charging. Gadgets are -powered- by power banks. Also, the fighters emphasize that when it gets dark, they try not to use any light, they put the -airplane- mode on their phones. Starlinks are also not used, so as not to -burn- positions. At that moment, a dog runs past us, and the guys from the kitchen are yelling to keep an eye on things. Indeed, the dog wanted to chew on the pixel shoulder bag, which later would not be so easy to find in the yellow-green sheet. - They are always dragging around here - yesterday they grabbed a knife and hid it somewhere in the thicket. The other day, a stapler was taken and stolen. So why? Puppies love to cause harm, but once I hung up underwear and T-shirts, they gnawed some, and -dragged- the rest somewhere, - says Oleg. On the way to the next dugout, the fighter tells us about a woodpecker, who was not prevented by oilcloth from finding the desired log: he was so busy that he tore the -roof- at the entrance to the dugout for the boys. He also points to the forest road and says: -This is Festival Street, and over there on the side is Tykha Street.- This is how fighters jokingly call the combination between positions. The guys say that camouflage and distraction are very important in these places. By the way, the -swamp- camouflage net will soon be replaced by a -gray- one. Two brothers live in the second dugout. It is made somewhat differently: the entrance here is directly from the street, the dugout itself is three meters high, and the perimeter is covered with foil insulation. Heating is still the same -burzuyka-. There is an improvised -summer house- nearby. In this part of the forest, it replaces the field kitchen, because here people are going to make coffee, smoke and chat. It's getting dark. We have to gather, so to say goodbye to the boys, we return to the field kitchen. -The forester- says that we must see the bathhouse, which the fighters built in literally three days. - We don't have the conditions to wash properly. -They made a summer shower first, and now it's cold, then they wrapped that shower nicely with cellophane, and put a stove in the middle,- he says with delight. The soldier then explains to us the rules of use: 15 minutes before taking a shower, you must come and throw a few logs into the stove. While they are burning, you go to get water (the one that is heated in a bucket in the kitchen). — That is, the system is like this — you stand in this single bath, warm water pours from above little by little, you wash, drops of water fall from you onto a heated -bottle-, which creates the effect of a sauna in a cellophane-insulated cabin, -explains -The Forester.- -Perhaps what fairy tale will you tell as parting?- - we ask the soldiers. In response, there is a conversation about black army humor and the fact that lately the enemy is making a breakthrough on this part of the front, which is why the number of shelling has increased sharply. - Here the sky is very dangerous - everything is flying, and KABs, and -Lancets-, and artillery. It happened that for three or four days in a row, every hour, some kind of flight arrived somewhere nearby. And if it's quiet, it means that they're waiting for a -lift- and it's about to start again, says -Bob-. The boys add that there used to be a -Saharok- in the dugout, but over time it squealed more and more often. So, when enemy UAVs began to fly very often, it was simply turned off, because it interfered with sleep. They still remember a funny story in farewell. About mice. They say that there were a lot of them here in the beginning. Ants, mosquitoes, flies and ground fleas also bothered. So, over time, the local kittens began to be nailed to the positions, and, as it turned out, this was the best way to get rid of the mice. - It happened that the cat caught a mouse and brought it to bed. Like, look what I caught you, - says one of the fighters and immediately adds: - Anyway, it's better than when I was wearing a -burka-: I put my foot in, I feel something there, I look, I crushed three mice. After that, he constantly checks the shoes before putting them on. And in general, the boys say, there are many different animals here - for example, herds of wild goats run around at night. After that, we say our goodbyes and leave the position in near darkness, hoping that there will never be any more wild animals from the northeast.

Title: -The highest degree of danger when I say -Svetka, pray--: the story of a professor who changed her j...
Description: Oksana Chorna told the correspondent of ArmiyaInform about what she had to experience during these years. Oksana herself recalls these days with a smile: - I tried to return to civilian life in 2017. I was demobilized, started working at the Academy of Sciences, but I was never able to transition from military to civilian life. It is really difficult: here you save people, take out the wounded, and there is paperwork… I decided that I had to change something. Oksana started volunteering - she went to visit her boyfriends who were stationed near Volnovakha. Since she had a category C license, she drove trucks and took out the wounded. It so happened that she was invited to a university in Oman. Since the summer of 2017, she worked there as a professor of economics at the Modern College of Business and Science in Muscat. And in March 2022, she returned to Ukraine after the start of a large-scale invasion, abandoning everything. — My husband went to serve in his unit, and I am a combat medic in the 57th brigade. At that time, fighting continued near the settlements of Toshkivka, Novotoshkivka, and Lysychansk. I took out the wounded. In my opinion, these were the most terrible battles during the entire time of the large-scale invasion. Then there was the defense of Kherson, Bakhmut, and later Avdiivka. It was very difficult. There were very few of our artillery there, while everything was firing at them - tanks, -barrel-, jet systems. True, there were no KABs yet, but -nurses- (unguided air missile (NAR) - the outdated designation of air missiles as NURS from the Russian -unguided rocket-. - Author) were constantly arriving. And this thing is unpleasant: thin, long, like a needle, flies and sticks at 80 degrees. Oksana then drove a white Mercedes Sprinter. It was an ordinary -fast- brought from Poland, painted in white-red-blue color: - At first I thought of repainting, but I realized that there is no point, because everything is just scattered there. We had a corner where we parked our cars. I remember that when I served in 2014-2016, I had a nice gurney. We put the wounded on it, and everything was fine. But during the battles near Lysychansk, Oksana had to throw away that gurney, because there were always so many wounded that they were stuffed into the car. She found sofa cushions in destroyed houses, threw them in the -ambulance- so that the boys could comfortably sit and lie on them. There was no connection anywhere - only in Lysychansk hospital: Starlink was there. — I came to the hospital, handed over the wounded. They tell me: -don't come back, there is heavy shelling.- But I'm leaving. The thought flashed through my mind that the road was under fire. I hesitated for a while. She left I'm coming Terrible shelling, it is clear that everything there is exploding, burning, as usual - the Russians then threw magnesium bombs at us, which did not extinguish in any way. You can only throw them off the car if you have time, of course. You take the wounded, go back, all the couch cushions are soaked in blood. You throw it away, you take others. It's all difficult… Oksana constantly mentions the courage of our defenders. She remembered one girl the most: - We took her out with a concussion, gave her to the doctors. And in two days, when I came to pick up the wounded, I saw her again. She simply returned to her own. However, this time she was seriously wounded by shrapnel. We took her out then. I don't know what happened to her next. But I still remember her — One of our positions was shot by a Russian tank. We thought they were all dead. No one made contact from there, the position was lost. Ours retreated. However, within a day, a guy from this position came directly to our medical center from there. He was all dressed in white, so white: face, uniform. He came out with a weapon. He said that he dug himself out because it was buried. In order to survive, he drank water from the battery in the building where they were hiding. He passed without a fight to our positions, reached the first aid station. The doctor examined him, he had an injury only from chest compression. He had no serious injuries, fractures or such open wounds. He slept for two days because he was under a lot of stress. Later, he returned to his position with his boys. He didn't even want to be evacuated… Oksana also remembered abandoned pets - dogs, cats… People were moving out and simply leaving their dogs or cats behind. She recalls that there were a lot of injured animals and how doctor Svitlana tried to treat one of them. — But during the Kherson operation, in the fall of 2022, there were already FABs (high-explosive aerial bombs. — Author). They were dropped with parachutes… And when we searched the fields there and took away our dead, I flew a drone, because there were mines everywhere. So, we flew a -mavik- over the fields to look for our dead, and at first I thought that these were bodies, as white as a body in appearance, but parachutes. There, all the fields were strewn with parachutes from FABs, she recalls. Oksana talks about her trips on the front roads as if it were about ordinary work: - I remember the roads very well. And also, when I drove the -fast-, I started convoys of armored vehicles, that is, I was followed by BMP. We stayed in Avdiivka for almost a year, then I knew every path where you can drive, I knew all the detours. If there was a battle or shelling going on, or just something burning there, I always had a -plan B-. To my question, what Oksana felt during these trips, she answers frankly without hesitation: - It was very scary. The greatest fear was when you arrived at a position and the Russians were already there. We had another girl there, a doctor at the medical center, Svitlana Balenko. And she and I went to the positions in Bakhmut together. We were so scared that we held hands, I was driving, she was next to me. I tell her: -Sveta, the cap is on- - this is the first degree of fear. Then, when it has already arrived, the second stage begins - -the cap is fastened-. And then, when you drive and everything is on fire, burning, you drive there, we had the highest degree of danger when I say -Svetka, pray.- And she began to read some prayer aloud. I say: -give me another one, you've already read this one.- And she knew a lot of prayers, and judging by the fact that we are sitting and talking, it probably helped. In 2024, the situation has changed a lot. Now, taking out the wounded is a very difficult and one hundred percent man's job, because you have to pull them out, carry them to the car. And just sitting in the medical center and not making trips, in Oksana's opinion, made no sense. - I can be useful in other areas of military life. Then she moved to the position of public relations officer. I am talking about my brothers. And recently I made a calendar. The guy whose photo illustrates -January- died. His brothers still have it hanging on the wall. They don't turn it over… P.S. Currently, Lieutenant Oksana Chorna has received a new assignment in another brigade. Her war continues… Photo by Olena Khudyakova and from the archive of Oksana Chornaya

Title: 1000 days of the great war: about victory without illusions and despair. ArmiyaInform interview with...
Description: And he also talked about why he chose the -Charter- brigade in particular, what the victory should be and what he plans to do the next day after it. — What is the greatest achievement of Ukraine to 1000 days of the great war? — The achievement, it seems to me, is that we hold on, that we did not give up, that we did not capitulate, despite the fact that at the beginning the balance of forces was not at all in our favor. I think this should be seen as positive. And some disadvantages - there are many of them. I think they should be talked about by specialists, experts who know more about military affairs. - And what is the biggest problem of Ukraine before 1000 days of the great war? - The problem of resources. Still, it is limited in our country. And if we talk about people who are ready to continue fighting, ready to continue to hold on and defend their country, then purely resource-wise, financially or, say, technically, or in the sense of the weapons that we have. But it seems to me that what we focus on is much more important. Do we focus on the positive without any excessive illusions, or do we still focus on the negative to the point of complete despair. — What is the most important question that Ukraine, the Ukrainian state and every citizen of Ukraine must answer now before 1000 days of a large-scale invasion? Is it the same question for all mentioned or can it be different, so, accordingly, different answers? — I think there are questions that further unite us. This is a question of what we are ready for for the sake of our country, for the sake of our future, how much we are ready to unite and what we are ready to do in this aspect. But I understand that the question is quite difficult, especially today, because now, as far as I can see, many people are emotionally tired. In addition, even the worldview is terribly misinformed, because our enemy works very skillfully and very effectively on our consciousness. — What advice would you give today to yourself 1000 days ago? Would you then and then for 1000 days do the same thing or would you do something different and different? - But in general the same. Perhaps I would advise myself to work more purposefully and in a more targeted way, after all, from then on, I should immediately set myself up for a long distance. I, like many compatriots, also experienced some emotional swings from falling into a certain euphoria when something was going well for us, to some dark days of despair. It takes a lot of effort. But hindsight is easy to be smart about. In fact, we all go through this path together, step by step. To make some mistakes, it seems to me, is natural. The main thing is to be able to draw some conclusions from them. — Since the first day of the war, since 2014, you have been volunteering, engaged in public activities. Why did you ultimately decide to join the Defense Forces as a serviceman?- I have always tried to be as efficient as possible. As long as there was an opportunity to work effectively as a volunteer - worked as a volunteer. But the law on mobilization was passed. I am a man of conscription age, a citizen of Ukraine of conscription age. As a law-abiding citizen, it was not even in my thoughts to dodge, hide or look for other options. Therefore, I immediately began to prepare for mobilization when I learned that such a law would be passed. —You have chosen the National Guard of Ukraine and the -Charter- brigade. Why NSU in particular and why -Charter- in particular? — The question of one's own effectiveness, one's own rational involvement was important to me and will remain important in the future. I know this unit, my friends and I created it, we saw how the unit was formed, how it grew, how it first turned from the DFTG into a full-fledged battalion, and then, actually, into a brigade of the National Guard of Ukraine. I know the leadership, the command of the brigade very well, I know many fighters personally. Thanks to this, I knew how I could contribute, how I could be useful, where I could be involved and where I could be effective. Therefore, for me, there was no special question regarding the -Charter-. —The experience of -Charter- is very positive, it is very media. How can this successful experience of -Charter- and other brigades be scaled to the entire Defense Forces of Ukraine? What should be done for this? - In fact, the -Charter- is not the only one. We have several divisions that perfectly understand that today both the autonomy of the division and the medialness of the division are important. And it's not about PR, it's definitely about efficiency. When you know how to build communications inside the unit and outside - both with business representatives and with representatives of the public - you have much more opportunities to provide your unit, to provide the soldiers with everything they need. It seems to me that this is definitely a positive thing, and it is probably not necessary to look for any negative here. It's important for Charter, it's a feature of Charter, and we actually try to be quite open in communication with society and to be honest. In my opinion, this creates a rather positive image of the brigade. Thanks to this, many people want to join the -Charter- today, in particular, fighters from other units are applying. I think this shows that the team is doing everything right. And how to transfer it to the experience of other divisions, is it possible to do it? I think it has to be done and, obviously, it cannot be done by the unit itself. It should still be an initiative on the part of the command, because, indeed, in many respects our Defense Forces need changes, need development, improvement. This should not be feared, it should be worked on, understanding that this is an improvement, that these changes will increase our efficiency, will make life easier for the fighter. — What should a real victory look like? What should we preserve in order to remain Ukraine? — Ukraine must preserve its statehood. Ukraine must preserve its citizens. This is the most valuable thing that can be - every human life, because every human loss, every human death is something irreversible, it is something that cannot be compensated in any way. And victory will be, it seems to me, future security, when the threat of defeat actually disappears, when the threat of human or territorial losses disappears. Therefore, I think that the issue of victory is not only purely physical, but also metaphysical. Here much will depend on what can be expected after the moment when the end of the war is announced. — Did you plan the day after the victory? What will you do after the war is over? - I have a lot of plans. In fact, I think it will somehow be further connected to the unit. -Charter- is not just a company of people who randomly got together, took up arms, and are going to disperse after the war is over. We create an environment, we create a community, a society. Regardless of whether this war ends, we will continue to have a lot of joint work, because we are united by our values, united by some common idea, common principles. Therefore, I think that I will meet this day in the company of my friends, with whom we are currently serving in the ranks of the brigade.

Title: Darknet in Russian: fakers spread lies about mercenary bodies
Description: The Russians are also spreading information that they are allegedly selling the heart of a murdered 31-year-old German mercenary who served in the Armed Forces on the darknet. The price of such an organ is allegedly $70,000. Propagandists assure that the organ is in -good condition- and is sold exclusively to Germans. The -proof- is a screenshot of an ad from the darknet. The darknet (dark web) is a network of encrypted online content that cannot be accessed through conventional search engines. To access the darknet, users install a private browser and a virtual network that helps hide their identity and location. Because of this anonymity, this network is often used to sell drugs, share stolen data, and conduct other illegal activities. But Russian fakers faked not only the darknet announcement about the sale of the heart, but even the photo. It is not a human organ, but the powerful drug opium. -Black transplantology- is a favorite topic of Russian propagandists. They constantly lie that the military's organs are -illegally- removed in hospitals. Although in reality no such case has been recorded. In the fake about the sale of the heart, the Russians combined two narratives at once - about -black transplant specialists- and so-called mercenaries. In this way, they wanted to assert that foreign military personnel in Ukraine are treated as cannon fodder, and after that they will also -sell- them for organs. The goal is to undermine the confidence of foreigners in Ukraine and reduce their support. We emphasize once again that there are no -mercenaries- in Ukraine. Foreigners serve in the Defense Forces under a contract and have the full status of military personnel.

Title: 1000 Days of All-out War: A Timeline of Evil
Description: 1,000 days of time, during which Ukraine etched its name on the world map with blood and iron, cultivated respect and admiration for the colors of its flag, the flawless geometric forms of the national coat of arms, and the chivalry of the Warriors of Light — the Armed Forces of Ukraine throughout the globe. 1000 days that established us as a monolithic nation — ethnically, politically, spiritually. Of course, in a war that has lasted 10 years and 9 months, more than a quarter of which is already large-scale, it is somehow no longer commilfo to speak such pathetic meanings. After all, on the 1000th day, one feels general fatigue from what is happening: from the daily statistics of losses, shelling, destruction, from the enemy's advances in the populated areas of eastern Ukraine that have been wiped off the face of the earth. In addition, every day everyone has to filter out hostile IPSOs from objective news in the information space, which is imposed on those who are mostly awake due to constant -shakhed- attacks of the night… But even though there is a war, life goes on. And everyone who lives this thousandth day will certainly remember all those stages of confrontation, which cause not only sadness, but also pride, respect, inspiration for further struggle towards our inevitable Victory. Let's remember and try to systematize the periods of the Russian-Ukrainian war and we, together with the military historian, head of the NGO -Military History Center- Vasyl Pavlov. -This war is the most informational of all the wars Ukraine has waged throughout its history. In connection with this, we have a large number of materials, information, testimonies that have completely different origins. These are official documents and unofficial videos on Facebook, TikTok, YouTube, etc. These are scientific studies, journalistic studies, articles in information resources, documentaries, stories in the news. All this creates a huge array of information that really needs to be systematized,- says Vasyl Pavlov. It is very important to remember and understand how a war develops, because every war has its stages. The large-scale one was preceded by a -hybrid- phase that began with the occupation of Crimea. Then, from July 2021, there was preparation for the -great war-, which, unfortunately, was inevitable. And when on February 24, 2022, the Russian Federation carried out an open, large-scale attack on Ukraine, a new period of Russian aggression against Ukraine began, which scientists also divide into parts. In particular, specialists of the National Defense University of Ukraine single out several strategic defensive and offensive operations, and Vasyl Pavlov prefers periodization by years. -Since we are in a new information society, where events develop faster, are analyzed faster, even history is written faster, then ordinary people, and information resources, and even scientists need much faster periodization. We de facto periodize this war by years, or by campaigns: the campaign of the 22nd year, the campaign of the 23rd year, the campaign of the 24th. Yes, the 2024 campaign can be conventionally divided, as is traditionally done, into winter-spring, spring-summer, summer-autumn, and now we have already entered the autumn-winter campaign. Each of these periods has its own peculiarities and characteristic features related to the climate, the territory, and nature, but at the same time they have features related, for example, to the mobilization campaign in our country, the completion or opening of hidden mobilization in Russia. They coincide with the provision or non-provision of military-technical assistance to us. That is, there are a lot of factors that can affect one or another periodization, no matter what it is - whether it will be calendar, or event, or symbolic, that is, it will be based on some individual symbolic events, from which we will count. For example, the periodization of 2022 was significant. In fact, it was all based not so much on the calendar as on significant events that could be celebrated (the Battle for Kyiv, the escape of the occupiers from Zmiiny Island, the Kharkiv and Kherson offensive operations.— Author). But such periodization is possible only during the active phase of hostilities, when both opponents are active. At the moment, due to a number of factors, we are forced to respond to Russia's actions. If we talk about the 2024 campaign, then the question of any war arises here: how do we write its history? Do we write history through our actions or do we write history through the actions of the adversary? I want to explain this. The description of any war is that it can be done in different ways: how the enemy acted and how we countered him, or how we acted and the enemy responded to our actions. And there is a significant difference in this. It consists in who sets the initiative, who describes and how he describes. They say that history is written by the victors (and in this war, I hope, we will win), but the situation demands that the history of this war be written before its end. And we do it, but the Russians do it too,- Vasyl Pavlov explains. In particular, the destruction of the Russian A-50U long-range radar detection aircraft over the Sea of ​​Azov and the Krasnodar Territory, the signing of Security Agreements and the Global Peace Summit, battles in the north of Kharkiv region and in the Kursk region of the Russian Federation were significant for us in the current year. -The Kursk operation is really a completely new milestone, a new element. This is not the liberation of the occupied territories, but the transfer of hostilities to the official territory of the enemy, which is recognized as international borders. But, as in our case, no international organization could influence these actions. Frankly speaking, Ukraine committed an act of aggression. There is nothing wrong with that. We committed an act of aggression in response to an act of aggression. But we did do something that is very difficult to do in defensive wars — we moved the fighting into the enemy's territory. In this way, as they like to say, we turned the board upside down. That is, we changed the rules of the game, changed the approaches to them. And thus, many plans of the Russians for the summer-autumn campaign, for the second part or for the end of the summer, were fundamentally confused. After all, they were forced to respond to this, and to respond, perhaps, not so much on the front line itself, but in the information plane, for their citizens. They can advance as much as they want on the territory of Ukraine, but they still cannot get rid of the fact that Ukrainian troops are on the territory of Russia itself. This territory is quite large. And what to do with these troops, Russia has not invented at the moment,- Vasyl Pavlov notes. Historically, people remember the -last blood- - the war closest to them in time. Such was the Second World War for many of us before the events of 2014, and then in 2022. Once, when I was a schoolboy and learned that the period of German occupation of Kyiv lasted 778 days, I thought for a long time about what it was like to live in prison for so long, without rights and freedoms, under the threat of being shot at any moment. Old people in the 1990s, recalling the -last war- — the Second World War, said that any troubles can be survived if there was no war. But she is. Every day for 1000 days, the enemy has been trying to destroy us. Mariupol, for example, has been under occupation longer than during World War II. Now the collective memory of Ukrainians is building a grandiose canvas of images and symbols, events and phenomena, heroes and anti-heroes, which became decisive in the Ukrainian resistance to Russian aggression and will form the image of the -last blood-, the -last war- for future generations. Therefore, the Russian-Ukrainian war and the Victory in it will remain the core of the national memory of Ukrainians for a long time. I want them to stay like this forever.

Title: The navies of Ukraine and Great Britain will improve unmanned technologies
Description: This was announced on November 18 by the Naval Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Among the main topics of the conversation are the results of the work of the Coalition on the development of maritime capabilities of Ukraine, the strengthening of the defense potential of our Navy and the development of promising directions, in particular, unmanned technologies. -Thanks to the support of Great Britain and other partners, we continue to improve our capabilities,- said Oleksiy Neizhpapa. He also informed his British colleague about the operational situation in the Black Sea, the participation of marines in combat operations on key areas of the front and the consequences of today's Russian attack on Odesa. Admiral Ben Key expressed his condolences to the victims of the Russian aggressor and assured that the partners will continue to do everything possible for Ukrainian victory. As reported by ArmyInform, the Commander of the Navy of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Vice Admiral Oleksii Neizhpapa met with the commander of the Royal Danish Naval Forces Rear Admiral Henrik Rüberg.

Title: The Armed Forces reported the number of shells spent in 2023
Description: About this in interv& #8217;yu RBC-Ukraine said the Deputy Commander of Missile Forces and Artillery of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Colonel Serhii Musienko. He said that the Soviet caliber of 152 mm is currently being superseded. -However, first of all, there is still production of these ammunitions in the world. And there are quite modern artillery systems that are currently in use in our troops of this caliber, and they are supplied with 152 mm shots. These are Czech DANA-M2 self-propelled guns and a Soviet Msta-B howitzer, Serhii Musienko reported. In 2022, the Defense Forces used about 1.5 million artillery munitions, ranging from 120 mm mines to rockets to MLRS. Half of them are of 152 mm and 122 mm caliber. A third were 155 mm shots. According to him, at the beginning of the full-scale invasion of Russia, the Armed Forces of Ukraine used 152 mm and 122 mm guns at the front. And starting from the middle of 2022, 155 mm and 105 mm howitzers, which were transferred by partners, began to appear in the Ukrainian troops. “Already in 2023, we spent more than 3 million shells. Of these, 1.6-1.7 million were 155 mm ammunition. That is, half of the ammunition we used – it is 155 mm. By 2024, the ratio of 152 mm and 155 mm will be 1 to 10, respectively,- noted Serhii Musienko. According to him, along with the 155 mm caliber, the 105 mm caliber ammunition has proven itself well. As reported by ArmyInform,

Title: Doctors of last hope - a plastic surgeon and a pediatric oncologist save wounded soldiers
Description: The video was released on November 18 on the brigade's channel. The headquarters of the brigade is a place where wounded, bleeding, shocked and contused soldiers from the front are taken after heavy battles, shelling, and explosions. If they're here, it means they've been through hell, but still have a chance at life. At the headquarters, the wounded are given medical assistance, their condition is stabilized, and then they are taken to the hospital. Currently, the medical team of the 93rd brigade employs military surgeons who have proven themselves to be among the most experienced. They know how to deal with critical bleeding, lacerations, multiple debris and military stress. But they did not always have such special skills. One of the surgeons, Oleg Kolomiets, in civilian life was a pediatric surgeon and oncologist, treating children from cancer. And Viktor Rodin was a plastic surgeon before the war: he reduced noses and bellies, rejuvenated the face, enlarged breasts and performed other operations in the field of aesthetic medicine. About how the brigade headquarters works, whether it was difficult to switch from civilian to military specialization, which periods of the war were most memorable, what keeps the mentality of medics in the army afloat, see the story of the brigade: As reported by ArmyInform, the pilot with the call sign Lyolik from the Black Raven 93 unit of the mechanized brigade -Holodny Yar- kyyevi/->won the first competition in the history of Ukraine among fpv pilots, in which 15 combat brigades and units took part.

Title: More than 170 enemy -wings- in a week - -heavenly russer- continues
Description: This was announced on November 18 by the Ground Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. In particular, the following were destroyed: X-101 missiles — 10; UAV Shahed-131/136 — 117; Orlan UAV 10/30 — 8; zala UAV — 16; UAV supercam — 9; Lancet UAV — 11; Lightning UAV — 1; Privet-82 UAV — 2; UAV grenades — 2. As reported by ArmyInform, the occupiers /->began to use new reconnaissance UAVs of the enemy, which are equipped with a camera and artificial intelligence.

Title: They put on two positions - our stormtroopers put on a whole show for the sake of a successful assau...
Description: The video of the operation was released on November 18 on the battalion channel. The assault took place in the Novogrodivka area of ​​Pokrovsky District. Our stormtroopers initially sent a light armored vehicle into battle, which was supposed to divert attention and avoid impression. After her, two heavier armored vehicles with the landing party went into battle. They landed assault teams on two enemy positions, where a sweep was carried out: a captured dugout in which the occupiers were hiding. -The clear plan and jewel-like coherence of the actions of our fighters led to the fulfillment of the task,- the battalion commented on the video.   As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 425th assault battalion -Skala- dvi-brygady-armiyi-rf/->cause serious losses to the 30 and 35 brigades of the Russian army, which are trying to advance towards Pokrovsk in Donetsk region.

Title: Armiya+ is preparing to launch a national military support program — Rustem Umyerov
Description: On November 18, Rustem Umyerov, the Minister of Defense of Ukraine, announced this. In a special section of the program, servicemen will be able to: -Thank you to the first companies that have already joined the program: -Ukrzaliznytsia-, -Ukrnafta-, -Nova Poshta- and Rozetka. This is a shining example of the social responsibility of a business that helps the military. We also call on other companies and public organizations to join,- wrote Rustem Umyerov. According to him, you can apply for participation via the link.   -Together with the business, we are creating a convenient platform that allows our defenders to get everything they need quickly and comfortably. We are joining forces for the sake of victory!-, Rustem Umyerov noted. As reported by ArmyInform, more than 50% of reports for changing the place of service in Army+ successfully agreed.

Title: More than 50% of reports for changing the place of service in Army+ have been successfully approved
Description: This was reported by 18 November Deputy Minister of Defense for Digitalization Kateryna Chernogorenko. -The numbers speak for themselves - servicemen were really waiting for the opportunity to change their place of service without long approvals, bureaucracy and groundless refusals. Now, even if the transfer is refused, the system is guaranteed to report the reasons for the negative response,- Kateryna Chernogorenko wrote. She named the most common reasons for translation refusals: -On the other hand, the number of approved reports shows that the service works efficiently. We are already working on making the service available to all Defense Forces. Digitization continues to transform our army into the army of the future, where any service is obtained simply, transparently and quickly. So that the military is engaged in service, not paperwork. In addition, the service is exactly in its place,- noted Kateryna Chernogorenko. As reported by ArmyInform, the Ministry of Defense explained whether it is possible to register for military service remotely.

Title: Barber on the Border: Establishes a connection and follows the beards of fellows
Description: He told about his summons at the exit of the subway, mobilization, studies in Great Britain, civilian profession and service. According to Vyacheslav, work in a barbershop is similar to current military work. Both then and now it's about one thing - connecting people. -I have a very interesting job. It is sometimes a little non-standard, when you have to climb on roofs, install antennas, deploy -starlinks-, run all these cables, wind them around the premises. There is always something to do,- says the signalman of the Luhansk border detachment of the -Revenge- brigade. As reported by > ArmyInform, RUBAK operators of the -Revenge- brigade spent a productive week and announced enemy losses for seven combat days.

Title: Surrendered as prisoners and therefore they will live - Russian winners of natural selection were di...
Description: The video of the fight was released on November 18. A quick assault on enemy positions was a surprise for the Russians. Some of them surrendered and others died. The captives wrote an appeal to the command of the Russian army with a request to exchange themselves for -Azov- fighters.   As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 12th special purpose brigade -Azov- of the National Guard budivlyah-z-okupantamy/->directed our aircraft at assault groups of Russians, and also struck with drones and artillery

Title: Disposal of armored personnel carriers, spectacularly - our pilots again staged an armored carnage i...
Description: A video of the mass destruction of Russian armor appeared on November 18 on the unit's channel. Enemy equipment was destroyed mostly on the roads, where the Russians tried in columns. In addition to armored personnel carriers, tanks, BMPs and other armored vehicles, as well as trucks, were also hit. Several pieces of destroyed equipment have already accumulated on some sections of the road, but the Russians have been fitting more and more new ones all the time.   As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the UA_REG Team unit of the Special Operations Forces of the Armed Forces destroyed a large amount of enemy equipment while repelling assaults in Kurshchyna.

Title: Rustem Umerov: Ukraine is increasing the production of missiles
Description: This is stated in the message of the minister on the page in Facebook. The minister recalled that on April 13, 2022, the Neptune missile complex destroyed the flagship of the Russian Black Sea Fleet, the cruiser -Moskva-. It became a historic moment and demonstrated the strength of our national missile armament. -Today we are increasing the production of Ukrainian missiles. The first 100 rockets of this year have already been produced. Serial production of R-360 -Neptun- cruise missiles with improvements for hitting targets at longer distances has been successfully scaled,- said Rustem Umyerov. Also, according to him, new drone missiles are being developed, in particular -Palyanytsia-, which is an example of successful cooperation between the state and the private sector. -We work in this direction with foreign partners as well. Thank you to everyone who works for our victory over our Ukrainian missiles that destroy the enemy. Together we make Ukraine stronger,- the minister added.

Title: A grenade, an FPV drone, a mine - the occupier was blown to bits
Description: A video with a vivid ending was released on November 18 on the unit's channel. The pilots of Quick Death spotted two invaders who dared to climb to clear the minefield. Our pilot threw a grenade at one of the Russians and, almost at the same time, soldiers from the Wild Division 82 of the Bukovyna Assault Brigade, who wanted to hit the Russian with their FPV drone, hit an anti-tank mine next to the enemy. As a result, the invader changed into gaseous form and demobilized.   As reported by ArmyInform, the drones of the Quick Death unit of the Kharkiv border detachment showed the damage of the Russians right in the fortifications.

Title: The president from Donetsk region congratulated the Ukrainian sergeants
Description: The video address was published on November 18 on the President's website. -I wish you health, dear Ukrainian men and women! Today — at the front. Now — Kupyansk. I was already in Pokrovsk. In our brigades. I congratulated the boys and girls - our soldiers - on Sergeant's Day. Sergeants are warriors without whom the normal work of officers and our units in general cannot be imagined. I am grateful to all sergeants, who are truly an example for a soldier. The strength of our entire Ukrainian army is people who serve, serve faithfully and steadfastly. Today I had the honor to award state awards to the best soldiers - those who proved themselves in battle. Heard the reports of our commanders. Also - reports on the security situation, social situation in Donetsk region and Kharkiv region. We hold our positions! Thanks to the soldiers! Glory to Ukraine!- Volodymyr Zelenskyi said. As reported by ArmyInform, the President in Donetsk acquainted with the construction of fortifications and held a meeting in Kramatorsk.

Title: How our tank tricked an enemy drone — a unique maneuver near Kurakhov
Description: The video of the duel was released on November 18 on the unit's channel. Two of our tanks entered an occupied village near the city of Kurakhovo and with direct fire destroyed several houses with a concentration of enemy manpower. Having worked on the targets, the first tank released a smoke screen and began to move away. All of a sudden, an enemy FPV drone appeared and tried to attack the second tank standing in cover. But it turned out that our tankers were ready for an uninvited guest. First, they stopped in the lowlands, which provided a radio shadow for controlling the kamikaze drone. Secondly, the most vulnerable part of the tank - the stern - was covered by bushes. Enemy drones made several unsuccessful attempts to attack the tank, after which it hung up and began to wait for our tankers to come out of their hiding place. Our tank made a deceptive maneuver, gave smoke, with which it deceived the invaders. Enemy pilots began to look for a tank where it was no longer there. At this time, both tanks took cover with their EW and went to their positions. And the enemy drone lost control and flew up, only to fall.   As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the -Sharp Cartouches- unit of the National Guard /->destroyed Russian attack aircraft, which were traveling on two golf carts.

Title: The Russians set fire to Donetsk region, HIMARS missiles are coming at the invaders: a stream from t...
Description: Fighters break into the enemy landing on Oshkosh M-ATV armored vehicles, eliminate the Russians and capture their position. Scouts of the 15th OBRAR -Black Forest- and 128th OGSHBr adjust the HIMARS, which fired at the cluster of Russians. They attacked the enemy in the area of ​​the settlement of Tavria, Zaporizhzhia region, at first two rockets flew at the Russians, when the wounded occupants began to be evacuated, another rocket with a cluster filling flew at them. In the Pokrovsky direction, guardsmen of the -Chervona Kalina- brigade, together with the -Typhoon- BSSP, destroyed one of the machines of the -Borysoglebsk-2- Russian automated complex of radio-electronic suppression. It allowed the occupiers to jam the communications and navigation of the Defense Forces. These and other topics are discussed by our presenters - Captain Artem Golub and Lieutenant Colonel Serhii Misyura.

Title: Enemy activation is possible: Russian airstrikes have increased in Kharkiv Oblast
Description: About this on the air of -Social News- spoken the spokesman of OTU -Kharkiv- lieutenant colonel Yevgeny Romanov. According to Yevgeny Romanov, the tactics of the invaders in the north of Kharkiv region have not changed, they still attack in small groups. However, the active involvement of aviation can prepare the ground for escalation. -The number of bombings indicates that activation is possible here. Because it's a distraction. But this does not significantly affect the state and position of our troops,- said the spokesman of the Kharkiv OTU. However, Yevgeny Romanov notes, one of the enemy's most common needs is to replenish the current set of troops. Because the ZSU is effectively destroying Russian manpower and equipment. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that the enemy assaults in Kharkiv Oblast were choked, in just one day the defenders' -deeds- amounted to 81 wounded and 53 killed enemies.

Title: -Two hundred prisoners at once- - the Russian commander orders to commit a war crime
Description: This was reported by GUR MOU. The recorded fact is yet another proof of purposeful genocidal policy of the occupying army in the criminal war started by Russia against Ukraine. The enemy broadcast also confirmed the severe wounding of a Muscovite with the call sign -thunderstorm-. The occupant with the call sign -vulture-, who was in the same group as the -thunderstorm-, is ordered to drag him with a tourniquet, administer painkillers, take up a position and fire. As reported by ArmiyaInform, on November 11, during the monitoring of information in social networks a publication with a video recording of the alleged shooting of two unarmed Ukrainian servicemen by representatives of the Soviet Union in the Kursk direction was discovered.

Title: In Odesa, the number of victims of the Russian missile attack is increasing
Description: This was announced by Oleg Kiper, the head of Odesa Regional State Administration. The liquidation of the consequences of the enemy strike continues on the spot, and the fight for the lives and health of the victims continues in hospitals. In connection with the death of 10 people, tomorrow, November 19, a day of mourning has been announced in Odesa and the region. As reported by ArmyInform, as a result of the Russian attack on Odesa 10 people died - 7 policemen, a medic and two local residents. Civilian infrastructure in the middle of the city was damaged: residential buildings, educational institutions and motor vehicles.

Title: The General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine: the hottest in the Kurakhiv and Pokrovsky directio...
Description: This is stated in the operational information of the General Staff Armed Forces as of 16:00 on November 18. It is the hottest now in the Kurakhiv and Pokrovsky directions. The defense forces are taking all necessary measures to prevent the enemy from advancing deep into Ukrainian territory. Today, the communities of settlements of the Sumy region, such as Novenke and Pavlivka, were affected by the fire of enemy artillery and mortars. In addition, the Russians carried out airstrikes with anti-aircraft missiles in the Basivka area. In the Kharkiv direction the enemy made three attempts to storm the positions of our units in the Vovchansk area. Delivered airstrikes on Kozachya Lopan, dropping five anti-aircraft missiles. In the Kupyansk direction, the Russian occupiers attacked the Defense Forces seven times in the areas of Kruglyakivka and Lozovoy. Two clashes are still ongoing. Ukrainian soldiers steadfastly hold the defense and inflict losses on the enemy. In the Lyman direction, the invading army launched two attacks on Ukrainian positions near Novolyubivka and Bilogorivka during the day. One battle has ended, another is ongoing. On the Toretsk direction, with the support of aviation, the enemy tried to penetrate our defenses in the Toretsk area. Kostyantynivka was attacked by the KAB. In the Pokrovsky direction, the Russian invaders with the support of aviation made 17 attempts to push our defenders out of their positions in the Myrolyubivka, Promeny, Lysivka, Petrivka, Pustinka and Novooleksiivka districts. The defense forces restrained the onslaught and repulsed ten enemy attacks, seven skirmishes are still ongoing. In the Kurakhiv direction, the enemy army attacked 23 times near the settlements of Berestki, Sontsivka, Voznesenka, Dalnye, Elizavetivka, Katerynivka, and Antonivka. Six attempts by the occupiers to advance have already been repulsed. The enemy bombarded Romanivka and Dachne with anti-aircraft guns. In the Vremivsk direction, 12 enemy attacks took place near Trudovoy, Rozdolny, Makarivka, Rivnopol and Novodarivka. Seven skirmishes are ongoing. Six times the enemy unsuccessfully attacked our defenders in the Dnieper direction. The operation in the Kursk region is ongoing. Since the beginning of the day, Russian aircraft have carried out 15 strikes (21 KAB) on their own territory. Ukrainian soldiers repelled ten enemy attacks today, the fighting continues.

Title: In Donetsk region, the president got acquainted with the construction of fortifications and held a m...
Description: This was reported by Office of the President. Mykhailo Drapaty reported on the situation in key areas of the front, the use of various types of tactical-level drones and EW devices. The President also listened to a report on the construction of fortifications and mine barriers to strengthen the defense of the region. The head of Donetsk OVA noted that, in addition to military engineering units, workers from various regions of Ukraine and Ukrzaliznytsia are also involved in the execution of works. Volodymyr Zelenskyi familiarized himself with the process of erecting fortifications in the Pokrovsky direction, where most of the planned 600 objects have already been installed. The head of state talked with the builders and thanked them for their work. Separately, Vadym Filashkin reported on the socio-economic situation in the region, as well as the evacuation of children from certain areas. According to him, about 324,000 people live in the territory of Donetsk region controlled by Ukraine. Over 318,000 Ukrainian men and women were displaced during the mandatory evacuation, including 37,000 children. In addition, the course of the heating season was discussed during the meeting. 86% of the boiler plants that were planned to operate have been started. There is heat in most multi-apartment buildings, health care and educational institutions. At the same time, it is impossible to start the heating season in Pokrovsk city territorial community for residents of multi-apartment buildings. As reported by ArmyInform, President Volodymyr Zelensky visited the location 25 separate Sicheslav Airborne Brigade defending the city of Pokrovsk in Donetsk region.

Title: The marines captured and cleared the enemy's position in the Kurakhiv direction
Description: The video of the successful operation was published by the Naval Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Part of the enemy's personnel hid in the dugout, but the marines prepared explosive and large-caliber -gifts- for our uninvited guests. In the footage, you can see how our marines drive up to enemy positions on an armored car, from which fire is fired at the enemy from a large-caliber machine gun. After that, our soldiers cleared the enemy shelters. As reported by ArmiyaInform, in the Kurakhiv direction, the enemy is attacking and striking across the entire front with attempts to break through to the flanks. However, loses a huge amount personnel and equipment.

Title: In 2024, the Ministry of Defense ensured the supply of women's clothing for defenders worth UAH 158 ...
Description: About this reported in the MoU. A field suit and women's underwear have already been purchased and issued. Small sizes of socks, gloves, shoes for women are also available. In addition, two standard samples of women's body armor have been approved, and demi-season underwear, cold weather underwear, and winter jackets and pants are under testing. This was discussed at a working meeting of representatives of the Ministry of Defense and public organizations involved in supporting women in the army and providing for their needs, including clothing. Those present discussed the current state of provision of women in the army and acute problems that need immediate solutions. Particular attention was paid to the issues of adapting the military uniform to the physiological characteristics of women, as well as increasing the size grid and improving the quality of the uniform, which should provide maximum comfort and functionality for women defenders. In general, during 2024, the procurement agency of the Ministry of Defense of the DOT purchased women's clothing, namely demi-season field suits, elements of underwear, for UAH 158.3 million. -Women's clothing must meet all requirements and provide comfort during service. Thanks to cooperation with public organizations, we can quickly respond to needs and improve our processes related to the provision of women,- said Deputy Minister of Defense Dmytro Klimenkov. The Ministry of Defense of Ukraine expressed its gratitude to non-governmental organizations for their active participation in the processes of improving the conditions of service for women in the army and confirms its readiness for further cooperation in this direction.

Title: Rustem Umyerov told how much enemy equipment was destroyed thanks to the DELTA system
Description: According to the correspondent of ArmiyaInform, this was announced at the briefing of -MoU. Digitization. Results 2024,- said the Minister of Defense of Ukraine, Rustem Umyerov. The head of the Department of Defense noted that DELTA provides a technological advantage to the Defense Forces. -This is an innovative situational awareness system. It meets NATO standards, helps our military to coordinate on the battlefield and destroy enemy equipment. The key capabilities of DELTA are video analysis of the battlefield for detailed analysis and planning of operations, integration with various messengers in real time, and collection and analysis from various sources of situational awareness. Regarding the achievements of DELTA: more than 15 billion dollars worth of various enemy equipment was destroyed,- the Minister of Defense emphasized. As reported by ArmiyaInform, the Vezha battlefield video analysis platform, which transmits broadcasts from drones in real time and ensures effective damage to the enemy, became available in the combat system DELTA. DELTA entered the top three the most popular combat systems among the Ukrainian military.

Title: The occupiers shelled Kostyantynivka with artillery, killing two people
Description: reported this by the Donetsk Regional Prosecutor's Office. A 61-year-old woman and a 68-year-old man died as a result of an enemy strike during resuscitation measures from injuries that were not compatible with life. In addition, a 46-year-old citizen and an 89-year-old pensioner were injured. They were given medical assistance. During the attack, the victims were outside. Facades of residential buildings and cars were damaged. The head of the Donetsk State Administration reported that the Russians killed one more person today in Siversk — the city was also subjected to artillery shelling. As reported by ArmyInform, as a result of the Russian attack on Odesa 10 people died - 7 policemen, a medic and two local residents.

Title: The Minister of Defense named the number of citizens who updated their data through Reserve+
Description: According to the correspondent of ArmiyaInform, this was announced at the briefing of -MoU. Digitization. Results 2024,- said the Minister of Defense of Ukraine, Rustem Umyerov. The head of the Ministry of Defense noted that thanks to Reserve+, the updating of military data was simplified. -We have made this process convenient and paperless. Regarding data updates: We currently have 3.5 million people who have updated their military data through Reserve+. We tried to avoid queues and unnecessary bureaucracy,- noted Rustem Umyerov. Separately, he focused on the issue of online postponement in Rezer+: -There is a function for processing postponements for people with disabilities, about 150,000 Ukrainians have already taken advantage of this opportunity.- Rustem Umyerov also mentioned the army.gov.ua portal during the briefing. -Regarding online recruiting: now it is possible to independently choose a unit for service through the army.gov.ua portal and get information about recruiting centers,- the Minister of Defense of Ukraine emphasized. As reported by ArmyInform, 100,000 Ukrainians have already used online deferral service from the start of its launch in the Reserve+ application.

Title: In Odesa, the number of dead increased after the Russian strike -Iskander-
Description: This was reported by the National Police of Ukraine. In addition, another 39 people were injured, including 4 children and 14 law enforcement officers. Civilian infrastructure in the middle of the city was damaged: residential buildings, educational institutions and motor vehicles. Data on the final number of dead and injured, as well as a complete list of destruction and damage, are being established. The survey is ongoing, emergency services and law enforcement officers are working at the scene of the events, recording yet another crime of the Russian Federation. According to the Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, the enemy attacked Odessa ->ballistic missile -Iskander-M-, which was shot down by anti-aircraft defense. Debris of the rocket fell into the residential sector.

Title: The Air Force of the Ukrainian Armed Forces reported the details of the Russian missile attack on Od...
Description: This was reported by the Air Force of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. -Unfortunately, a downed enemy missile fell into the residential sector of the city's Primorye district and caused a lot of grief. There are dead and wounded. We express our condolences to the family and friends,- the message reads. In addition, at 11:45 a.m. on the approach to Odesa, an enemy UAV -Orlan-10- was shot down by anti-aircraft defense, which was probably sent for aerial reconnaissance. -The enemy is insidious and merciless... Odesa is constantly under the sights of the occupiers - terrorists deliberately launch strikes with various types of missiles and attack UAVs on densely populated cities, knowing that there will be victims among the civilian population,- the Armed Forces of Ukraine stressed. All citizens are urged not to ignore air alarms and to respond quickly to warnings. As reported by ArmyInform, 8 people were killed as a result of the Russian attack on Odesa /a>.

Title: - Burnt coffins of equipment remain: in the Kurakhiv direction - fierce defensive battles
Description: Major Bohdan Janush, deputy commander of the 79th separate Airborne Assault Brigade of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, announced this on the air of the national telethon -Yedini Novyni-. However, Bohdan Janusz assured, despite continuous attacks, the enemy is not succeeding. What's more, a sustained defense inflicts colossal losses on the occupiers. -The burnt coffins of equipment remain, a large number of enemy personnel remain to rot in the fields. Accordingly, we are exhausting the enemy's units,- said the deputy commander of the battalion of the 79th separate amphibious assault brigade. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in the Kurakhiv direction constant assaults of the Russian army continue, in one day the enemy can attack the position 4-5 times.

Title: The Army+ application is already used by more than 410,000 servicemen
Description: According to the correspondent of ArmiyaInform, this was announced at the briefing of -MoU. Digitization. Results 2024,- said the Minister of Defense of Ukraine, Rustem Umyerov. The head of the Ministry of Defense noted that Army+ is not just an application, but a full-fledged digital ecosystem that supports our military and makes their lives easier. -Army+ reduces all bureaucratic procedures, provides modern tools for effective management of development. Regarding electronic reports: they (military personnel in the Army+ application. — Ed.) can submit reports in a few clicks and receive resolutions from commanders in the shortest possible time. Regarding feedback: Army+ allows you to conduct surveys to analyze the needs of the military, improve food supply and material support,- Rustem Umyerov emphasized. The Minister of Defense also noted that in the application function of submitting a request to change the place of service. The function minimizes red tape and speeds up the transfer process. -Now more than 410,000 servicemen in 1,400 different military units use Army+. That is, it is a popular product, we will expand it,- added Rustem Umyerov.

Title: The President came to Pokrovsk and visited the location of Sicheslav paratroopers
Description: This is stated in the message of the head of state on page on Facebook. The President spoke with the defenders and honored them with state awards. -Tense direction. Only thanks to the strength of the soldiers, the East is not completely occupied by Russia. The enemy receives a daily response. Thanks to the soldiers for their courage!- Volodymyr Zelenskyi said. As reported by ArmyInform, our defenders stopped 32 assault and offensive actions of the aggressor in the areas of Myrolyubivka, Promin, Lysivka, Krutyy Yar, Yurivka, Hryhorivka, Pustinka and Petrivka.

Title: A man will be tried in Kharkiv Oblast, who leaked information about the Armed Forces to pro-Russian ...
Description: This is stated in the notification of the prosecutor's office. The accused is a resident of the village of Pisochyn and an active member of pro-Russian communities in the Telegram messenger. In August 2024, the man, on his own initiative, began to provide the administrator of one of them with information about the locations of Ukrainian defenders in the territory of the Kharkiv region. He reinforced the text messages with visual materials, adding screenshots of maps with appropriate markings. In addition, the accused participated in discussions of anti-Ukrainian Telegram channel posts. In the comments, the man glorified the military of the aggressor states, praising the -Russian character-, and also positively evaluated the decision of the Russian president to start the so-called -SVO-. The illegal nature of the man's statements was confirmed by the conclusion of the forensic linguistic semantic-textual examination. The law enforcement officers gathered evidence and exposed the man. At the request of the prosecution, he was remanded in custody. The man will be tried in the Kharkiv District Court of the Kharkiv Region. The accused faces up to eight years in prison with confiscation of property.

Title: Volodymyr Zelenskyi on the Russian shelling of Odesa: These are not accidental, but demonstrative st...
Description: This was stated by the President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyi. -These are not random hits - they are demonstrative hits. After the calls and meetings with Putin, after all the false gossip in the media about the alleged -abstention- from strikes. Russia shows what it is really interested in: only war. And this signal should be heard in all parts of the world, from the halls where the members of the -Group of Twenty- meet to all the capitals of the world,- he emphasized. The President reported that ballistic attack of Russian terrorists on Odesa hit a residential area, the flight happened in a parking lot. An apartment building, a university, and an administration building were damaged. As of now, it is known about 8 dead people. -My condolences to the families and loved ones. Almost two dozen more people were injured. All the necessary forces are involved to help everyone who needs it,- the head of state added.

Title: The occupiers hit Odesa with ballistic missiles: 8 were killed
Description: This was reported by Oleg Kiper, the head of Odesa Regional State Administration. As a result of the shelling of the occupiers, there are dead and wounded. Damaged civil infrastructure, in particular residential buildings. The Air Force of the Ukrainian Armed Forces warned about the threat of using ballistic weapons from the temporarily occupied Crimea. Updated. Oleg Kiper later reported that at least 8 people were killed and 18 injured as a result of the Russian attack. One child is among the injured. Four people are in serious condition. As reported by ArmyInform, on November 17, as a result of a ballistic missile attack on a residential quarter in Sumy 11 people died, more than 80 were injured.

Title: The occupiers hit Odesa with ballistic missiles, there are dead and wounded
Description: This was reported by Oleg Kiper, the head of Odesa Regional State Administration. As a result of the shelling of the occupiers, there are dead and wounded. Damaged civil infrastructure, in particular residential buildings. The Air Force of the Ukrainian Armed Forces warned about the threat of using ballistic weapons from the temporarily occupied Crimea. As reported by ArmyInform, on November 17, as a result of a ballistic missile attack on a residential quarter in Sumy 11 people died, more than 80 were injured.

Title: -Eat an elephant in pieces-: in the Kharkiv region, Russian attack aircraft are being destroyed on a...
Description: About this on the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyny- spoken the spokesman of OTU - Kharkiv- Lieutenant Colonel Yevhenii Romanov. According to Yevgeny Romanov, all assaults were repulsed, despite the fact that the enemy constantly changes their tactics. Ukrainian defenders already have their own answer to all these attacks. -If we talk about ``how to eat an elephant?'', then ``piece by piece''. Reconnaissance helps to find places of concentration of the enemy and deliver high-precision strikes on them in a timely manner. To prevent the enemy from reaching the front edge of our defense,- said Yevhenii Romanov. Earlier ArmyInform reported, the efforts of the Russian invaders to advance as far as possible on the northern border of the Kharkiv region before the change in weather conditions failed again.

Title: The enemy gets in the teeth: Defense forces hold back the Russian offensive in the Kursk region
Description: About this on the air of -Social News- told the spokesman of OTU -Siversk- , Colonel Vadym Mysnyk. According to Vadym Mysnyk, if the enemy has equipment, they attack with it, but if the equipment is knocked out, small groups of infantry are sent to storm. However, the tactic of -rolling- in Kurshchyna fails. -In recent days, even Russian propagandists have not indicated that they have success. The enemy here is getting in the teeth, and they can't do anything,- Vadym Mysnyk assured. As reported by ArmyInform , soldiers of the Special Operations Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine eliminated three servicemen of the Russian Federation as a result of successful direct actions on enemy positions in the Kursk region.

Title: A rare Russian complex -Borysoglebsk-2- was burned in the Pokrovsky direction
Description: This was notified at NSU. The successful operation to destroy the enemy complex was carried out by the Guardsmen of the Chervona Kalina brigade together with the Typhoon SSSP. With the help of -Borysoglebsk-, the occupiers tried to jam the communication and navigation of the Defense Forces of Ukraine. The cost of such a complex is about 200 million dollars. -Borysoglebsk-2- is a Russian electronic warfare complex. It is used to suppress satellite communications, radio navigation systems, and create interference in various ranges. It has been in service with the Russian army since 2013, and since 2014 it has been used by the enemy in the war against Ukraine. As reported by ArmyInform, soldiers of the Special Operations Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine as a result of successful direct actions on enemy positions in the Kursk region liquidated three servicemen of the Russian Federation and captured two.

Title: -Gunsmith's guide-: why private arms manufacturers need it
Description: TSU specialists created it based on the experience of companies working in the defense-industrial complex of Ukraine. Executive Director of the Technological Forces of Ukraine, Kateryna Mikhalko, told ArmiyaInform correspondent why there was a need to publish the -Armorer's Guide-. — As an association of private manufacturers, we have seen that enterprises at different stages of development are still faced with a misunderstanding of the sequence of state procedures. Because there are a lot of them (procedures - ed.), they do not always, let's say, have an unambiguous interpretation for the industry, - the executive director notes. According to her, TSU received many requests for clarification on the mechanisms of state regulation in the arms supply processes: — And we decided to form it into a single book. Where all the regulations would be collected, their sequence was described step by step, and what the manufacturer should do at the moment when he had the idea to make a new type of weapon - until the moment of passing all the procedures of the Ministry of Defense inspections. And then, actually, about signing a state contract and supplying these weapons to the army. Kateryna Mikhalko says that the -Gunsmith's Guide- was also published so that experienced manufacturers could give this book to their team members, and to make it easier for new employees to understand the field of weapons. - Also, this book was created so that small manufacturers who are just starting their journey could take the -Gunsmith's Guide- and understand what path awaits them in interaction with the state. To our partners and manufacturers who are part of the -Technological Forces of Ukraine- association, we made it publicly available for everyone. If there is any company outside our community, they can find it online with us at sites and read. That is, this is such a gift from our manufacturers to the entire industry, - stressed the executive director of the Technological Forces of Ukraine Kateryna Mikhalko. Photo by TSU

Title: The Defense Forces named the number of sergeants awarded the title of Hero of Ukraine
Description: About this ArmyInform told main sergeant of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Oleksandr Kosynskyi. According to him, since 2014, more than 25 thousand sergeants and foremen have received state awards, 105 of them - the title of Hero of Ukraine, unfortunately, 76 of them posthumously. -But they are our Heroes forever. Those who inspire us to continue the struggle, those who define the meaning of this struggle, our brothers in arms, who are waiting for us and look at us from the sky. We have no right to betray them, are obliged to fight, are obliged to We must win,- noted the chief sergeant of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. To the Sergeant Day of the Armed Forces of Ukraine ArmyInform spoke with Chief Sergeant of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Oleksandr Kosynsky, who explained why sergeants sometimes have to perform the duties of officers at the front and how the sergeant corps lives in the third year of a large-scale invasion.

Title: The Ministry of Defense approved the use of the FPV-complex -Vykhor- in the Defense Forces
Description: About this notified in the MOU. The FPV drones of this complex come in several size configurations. To control drones, the pilot uses a special remote control, FPV glasses and equipment for signal reception and transmission. Copters are fast, they can easily catch up with an enemy armored vehicle or car in motion. With the help of these FPVs, you can also hit the manpower of the occupants in the trenches and dugouts. Manufacturers can equip drones with additional equipment to perform a wider range of tasks.
