In particular, a 9-story building was damaged: the facade was mutilated, windows were broken, and cars were damaged. Based on this fact, a pre-trial investigation has been started under Part 1 of Article 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine - violation of the laws and customs of war. National Police investigators and the prosecutor's office are documenting the aftermath of the shooting. The investigation is ongoing, all the circumstances of the event are being clarified. As reported by ArmyInform, the troops of the Russian Federation /->launched a rocket attack on the place of deployment of the police in Kharkiv, as a result of which one policeman died.

Title: The defense forces repelled 126 attacks: Ukrainian soldiers restrained the Russian offensive in all ...
Description: This is reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The enemy launched 3 missile strikes (5 missiles), 52 air strikes (including 73 anti-aircraft missiles) and 400 kamikaze drone strikes, carried out 2,926 attacks on the positions of our troops. In the Kharkiv direction, one battle continues near Vovchansk. The enemy actively used aviation and carried out five airstrikes, dropping 11 anti-aircraft missiles in the areas of Dergachy, Riznikove, Hoptivka and Vilkhuvatka settlements, and also fired four anti-aircraft missiles in the Bochkovo area. The aggressor launched five attacks on our fortifications on the Kupyan direction. At this time, four clashes in the districts of Petropavlivka, Lozova, Kruglyakivka and Zagryzovo have ended, one more attack is ongoing. In the Lyman direction, Russian troops stormed the positions of Ukrainian defenders 14 times in the areas of Druzhelyubivka, Katerynivka, Grekivka, Makiivka, Terniv, and in the Serebryansk forest. All enemy attacks are repelled. In the Kramatorsk direction, three attempts by the invaders to advance near Stupochy ended in failure. In the Toretsk direction, the occupiers stormed the Toretsk and Shcherbinivka districts three times. Enemy bomber aircraft were active near Toretsk, Kostyantynivka and Petrivka. Fighting continues in one location. The enemy is intensively attacking the Ukrainian defenders on the Pokrovsky direction. In total, the enemy carried out 36 assault and offensive actions. The Russian occupiers are most active in the districts of Sukhoi Balka, Sukhoi Yar, Myrolyubivka, Mykolaivka, Lysivka, Krutoy Yar, Novogrodivka, and Selidovoy. Seven clashes in the direction are still ongoing. The enemy used aviation means of destruction in the areas of settlements of Myrolyubivka, Oleksandropol, and Stara Mykolaivka. In the Kurakhiv direction there are 48 combat encounters. The enemy's attacks were repelled by our soldiers in the districts of Ostrivskyi, Ilyinka, Novoselidivka, Kreminnaya Balka, Novodmytrivka, Vovchenka, Maksimilianivka, Dalnyi, Antonivka, and Katerynivka. The occupiers dropped anti-aircraft missiles near Kurakhovo and Dalnyi. In the Vremiv direction, the enemy twice tried to break through to Trudovoy, but our courageous defenders stood in the way of this. In the Dnieper direction, the operational situation has not changed significantly. The enemy conducted four unsuccessful assaults. There were no significant changes in the situation in other directions. The department also recognized Ukrainian soldiers from the 141st Separate Infantry Brigade, 126th Separate Territorial Defense Brigade, 38th Separate Marine Brigade, 425th Separate Assault Battalion, and 48th Separate Assault Battalion who steadfastly restrained the onslaught of overwhelming forces. the enemy on the eastern front. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 10th mountain assault the -Edelweiss- brigades brilliantly repelled the attempt of a Russian assault.

Title: Consequences of the attack on Kyiv: a high-rise building was partially destroyed in one of the distr...
Description: This was reported by the head of the KMVA, Serhiy Popko. As a result of the impact of UAVs in the Solomyansk district of the capital, debris hit a residential building. There are preliminary reports of damaged windows in several homes, but there are no reports of injuries or significant damage yet. In addition, at least five parked cars were damaged. At the same time, in the Sviatoshyn district, as a result of falling debris, a fire broke out on the upper floors of a 16-story residential building. The fire covered an area of ​​about 15 square meters. There is a possibility of partial destruction of the upper floors. Rescuers are promptly evacuating residents, and information on possible victims is being clarified. As reported by ArmyInform, the troops of the Russian Federation /->launched a rocket attack on the place of deployment of the police in Kharkiv, as a result of which one policeman died.

Title: A tragic day for Kharkiv: the occupiers fired rockets at the police, dozens of people were injured
Description: The Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office informed about this. It is currently known that 40 people were injured in the missile attack on Kharkiv, including 30 police officers, a rescue worker and nine civilians. According to preliminary data, the shelling took place on November 1 around 4:00 p.m., when two S-300/400 type missiles hit the police administrative building. In addition to the damaged police building, private homes, high-rise buildings, shops and more than 10 vehicles were also damaged. A pre-trial investigation has been launched into the fact of violation of the laws and customs of war, combined with intentional murder. In addition, as a result of an airstrike in Kupyan Oblast, three civilians were injured. According to the investigation, on November 1, at around 2:55 p.m., Russian troops launched an airstrike on the village of Vilkhuvatka of the Kupyan district. An 85-year-old woman and two men aged 87 and 59 had an acute stress reaction. Private homes were damaged. As reported by ArmyInform, Kharkivshchyna came under enemy shelling, as a result of which civilians were injured and significant damage was caused to the infrastructure.

Title: Hypersound has reached Turkey: Ankara will develop a charge based on a ballistic missile
Description: How states the TurkishFacts4u page on the X social network, in the Republic of Turkey confirmed not only the fact of the existence of such a weapon, but also its practical testing, ArmyInform reports. Mach 5.5, and this fact refers Turkey to a rather narrow circle of countries that have hypersonic technologies. Defense market analysts who are the authors of the Army Recognition portal note that hypersonic missiles, the speed of which exceeds Mach 5, have high maneuverability and are practically invulnerable to modern anti-missile defense systems. Traditionally, the Tayfun missile in its basic configuration, the SRBM (Short Range Ballistic Missile) can engage targets over 500 km away. Turkish developers assured that its maximum range is up to 1,000 km. The missile in ballistic configuration with a length of 6.5 meters, a diameter of 610 millimeters and a mass of 2,300 kg identifies the target using a coordinate guidance system. The Tayfun, equipped with a pre-formed cluster warhead, has a high hit accuracy with a CEP (Circular Probable Error) value of 10 meters or less. The hypersonic version of this missile promises to significantly increase the speed, range and effectiveness of destroying targets. > Although detailed technical characteristics, such as range, payload and methods of evading countermeasures, have not yet been published, experts are already stating significant progress in the development of Turkish missile technology. Observers note that the company Roketsan, founded 1988, plays a key role in ensuring Turkey's self-sufficiency in the field of defense technology. The latest developments in the field of hypersonics demonstrate its ability to create advanced weapons. These successes confirm that Turkey is ready to compete at the world level and aims to become an important player in the global arms race, where hypersonic technologies are becoming one of the key directions. The development of this type of weapons shows Turkey's desire to strengthen its position on the world stage and significantly increase its strategic and defense potential. At the very least, the creation of a hypersonic version of the Tayfun SRBM can significantly strengthen Ankara's position in the Mediterranean, the Middle East and other strategically important regions, analysts concluded. Short Range Ballistic Missile (SRBM) launch ) Tayfun. Video: Roketsan

Title: From -rat- to oath: how the military oath evolved in Ukraine
Description: Taking the oath was started in the 9th century. with the arrival of the Varangians to the Ukrainian lands. Rata - that's what the oath to the prince was called. Accordingly, the soldiers were originally called -ratai-, that is, the one who took the rata (oath). Joining the wife, the soldiers swore their loyalty to the prince, and after that the soldiers were considered brothers. The Zaporozhye Cossacks inherited this tradition. When a new warrior came to Sich, he went through reception rites. Among them was a solemn oath of allegiance to the society and acceptance of Orthodoxy if the man was of a different faith. Subsequently, in the period of the XVII-XVIII centuries. the Cossacks were forced to swear an oath to the Russian tsars. It is obvious that at that time it was a forced measure, because the Cossacks swore to them for political reasons. The military oath of the Legion of Ukrainian Sich Riflemen also faced a test in the form of the Austrian military command, because the Sich Riflemen were part of the Austro-Hungarian army. According to the plan of the authorities, they had to swear an oath to the government of Austria-Hungary. But the volunteers who joined the ranks of the SSS went to the ranks of the army with the goal of defending their homeland from the Russians and serving their own Ukrainian people, so they had no desire to swear allegiance to a foreign state and its people. However, due to poor technical support and the threat of dissolution of the SSS, on September 3, 1914, the troops of the SSS Legion were forced to take an oath of allegiance to Austria-Hungary and its emperor. But the USS military did not put up with this and drew up its own alternative text of the oath of loyalty to the native Ukrainian people, although it did not receive official approval. The text was as follows: -I, …, the Ukrainian Sich Archer, swear to the Ukrainian princes, hetmans, Zaporizhia Sich, graves and all of Ukraine, that I will faithfully serve my Motherland, defend it from the enemy, fight for the honor of Ukrainian weapons until the last drop of blood. So, Lord God and Archangel Michael, help me. Amen.- Under the text of the oath, the soldiers who took the oath must sign. This made the oath more weighty. Special attention should be paid to the wording -to serve the Motherland, to defend it against the enemy- because this was the main motivation of the volunteers. On July 24, 1918, the Council of Ministers of the Ukrainian State of Hetman Pavlo Skoropadsky passed the Law on General Military Conscription. They tried to recruit only those citizens who demonstrated -unconditional devotion to the idea of ​​an independent Ukraine- to the army. Hetman Skoropadskyi also approved the -Law on the Military Oath of Allegiance to the Ukrainian State-. The text of the oath was provided in short changes for conscripts of various religions and nationalities living in the Ukrainian State. The text of the oath: -I promise and swear by Almighty God and the Holy Gospel that I will serve, without sparing my life, faithfully and sincerely to the last drop of blood to the Ukrainian State and His Highness Hetman, the Supreme Commander of the Ukrainian Army and Navy. I will in all cases put up the greatest possible resistance to the enemies of the Ukrainian State, I will watch over all the interests of the Ukrainian State and sacredly guard the official secret entrusted to me and obey without objection all orders for the needs of the service and the State, conscientiously perform all my duties and do nothing for my own benefit to do something that would be contrary to my service and oath. I will never forsake my unit and my Flag, and in all cases I will behave as befits an honest, faithful, conscientious, brave and conscientious (officer or soldier). May God help me in this, and in the end I kiss St. Scripture and the Cross of my Savior. Amen.- This time, the Ukrainian army immediately had the opportunity to swear to its own people and native land. In addition, the Hetman administration took important steps in the organization of the future Ukrainian army. On November 13, 1918, in Lviv, the Ukrainian National Council of the ZUNR approved the text of the -Oath of Ukrainian Troops- by its resolution. It was set out in the following format: -We solemnly swear to Almighty God to faithfully and obediently obey the Western Ukrainian People's Republic, Its Supreme Authority, Its Government, Its Army, as well as to all Its chieftains and all Its leadership, to respect and protect them, their orders and suggestions in every service to be carried out, against every enemy, whosoever he may be, and wherever the will of Her Supreme Authority shall require, on the waters, on the lands, in the air, by day and by night, in battles, offensives, skirmishes and in all kinds of enterprises, in other words, in every place, at every time, on every occasion, to fight bravely and bravely, never to abandon our troops, flags and weapons, never to enter into the slightest understanding with the enemy, always to act according to the laws of war demand and how honest soldiers face to live and die in honor in this way. Yes, God, help us - Amen.- The Ukrainian Galician Army was the most capable Ukrainian military formation during the First Liberation Struggle in 1917-1921. In January 1919, the authorities of the Ukrainian People's Republic approved a sample oath or, as it was then called, -The Promise-. Subsequently, on March 12, 1919, on behalf of the Directory in Vinnytsia, Chief Ataman of the Army of the Ukrainian People's Republic Simon Petliura approved the new text of the oath of the Ukrainian troops. The oath took place solemnly, as a rule, it was attended by high-ranking state officials. Galicians freed from Serbian captivity swear allegiance to Ukraine and the Ukrainian army, August 3 1919. Photo: wikipedia.org Text of the oath: -I swear by the honor of a citizen of the Ukrainian People's Republic and I solemnly swear to Almighty God to faithfully serve the Ukrainian People's Republic, obediently obey its supreme authority of the Directorate, the government and the people's army. I swear to respect and protect the orders and all recommendations of their service, to carry them out exactly against any enemy of the Ukrainian People's Republic and the working people, whoever this enemy may be and wherever the will of the Supreme Republican Power will demand: on water, on land, in the air , day and night, in battles, offensives, skirmishes and all kinds of enterprises, in a word, in every place, at every time and in every case fight bravely and courageously to the last drop of blood. Do not throw away your military units, flags and weapons in any case, do not enter into any, even the smallest, understanding with the enemy, always behave as the military laws and the honor of a warrior-knight require, in this way and honor to live and honor to die Help me in this, Holy God, my love for my native Ukraine and the people.- The Ukrainian military organization was established in 1920 in the western Ukrainian lands. The members of the Ukrainian military organization were veterans of various military formations, first of all, the Sich Riflemen of the Army of the Ukrainian People's Republic and the Ukrainian Galician Army. Colonel Yevhen Konovalets, the former leader of the Sich Rifle Corps, headed the UVO. Each new member of the UVO had to swear an oath of loyalty to the organization. The oath was taken in a secluded place in a narrow circle of people. Those who took the oath raised the three middle fingers of their right hand, and put the left one on the weapon. And various texts of speeches were delivered. Usually, the oath was about unfailing execution of the orders of the leadership of the UVO and about signing a death sentence in case of treason. The OUN and the UPA, following the traditions of the UVO, presented their own text of the oath on July 11-15, 1944, at the founding Great Meeting of the Ukrainian Main Liberation Council near the village of Sprynya. It was prepared by the OUN leadership and the UPA Main Team. The oath entered into force by order of the General Military Staff of the UPA on July 19, 1944, and was published in the magazine -Povstanets- in November 1944. It was accompanied by instructions on the procedure for its preparation and celebration events. The oath was taken after the training, when the soldiers were already sure of their choice. For this event, the warriors prepared in advance by memorizing the text. The ceremony took place on a wide lawn, the rebels were festively dressed and with weapons in their hands, all this was accompanied by a divine service. The first collective oath was administered on August 5, 1944 by the Chief of the Main Military Staff of the UPA for the soldiers of the 3rd Hundred - -Snakes-, -Mace- and -Lions- - using the text approved by the UGVR. Text of the oath: -I, a soldier of the Ukrainian Insurgent Army, having taken up a weapon, solemnly swear by my honor and conscience before the Great Ukrainian People, before the Holy Land of Ukraine, before the spilled blood of all the Best Sons of Ukraine, and before the Highest Political Leader To the People of Ukraine: To fight for the complete liberation of all Ukrainian lands and the Ukrainian people from the invaders and to win the Ukrainian Independent Cathedral State. In this struggle, I will spare neither blood nor life and will fight until my last breath and final victory over all the enemies of Ukraine. I will be courageous, brave and brave in battle and merciless towards the enemies of the Ukrainian land. I will be an honest, disciplined and revolutionary-vigilant soldier. I will follow all the orders of my superiors. I will strictly preserve military and state secrets. I will be a worthy brother in battle and combat life to all my comrades-in-arms. When I break or deviate from this oath, let me be punished by the strict law of the Ukrainian National Revolution and let the contempt of the Ukrainian of the people.- Modern Ukraine On August 24, 1991, together with the adoption of the Act of Proclamation of Independence of Ukraine, the resolutions -On the Proclamation of Ukraine's Independence- and -On Military Formations in Ukraine- were also adopted. In November 1991, at the 2nd Congress of the Union of Officers of Ukraine, where Defense Minister Kostyantyn Morozov was present, the participants took the first unofficial oath of loyalty to Ukraine. On December 6, the Council of Ukraine adopted the laws of Ukraine -On the Defense of Ukraine- and -On the Armed Forces of Ukraine-, and also the resolution -On the text of the Military Oath- approved the text of the military oath solemnly taken in the Verkhovna Rada by the First Minister of Defense of Ukraine, Colonel General Kostiantyn Morozov. After the VRU resolution -On the text of the Military Oath- was approved on December 6, on December 23, soldiers led by Martirosyan on the Independence Square in Rivne took it, publicly swearing allegiance to Ukraine. The text of the oath: -I, (surname, first name and patronymic), join the military service and solemnly swear to the Ukrainian people to always be faithful and loyal to it, to defend Ukraine, to protect its sovereignty, territorial integrity and inviolability, honestly and to honestly perform military duty, the orders of commanders, to strictly adhere to the Constitution of Ukraine and the laws of Ukraine, to keep state secrets. I swear to fulfill my duties in the interests of my compatriots. I swear never to betray To the Ukrainian people.- In peacetime, the day of taking the oath is declared a holiday for the military unit, usually it is a weekend. The commander determines the time and place by separate order, announcing to the personnel. Native military personnel and guests may be invited to the ceremony, priests or religious representatives may be present. Military personnel come in full dress uniform, but during martial law the uniform is determined by the commander. The party lines up, and those taking the oath stand in front. The ceremony begins with a speech by the commander, followed by speeches by representatives of the higher command and veterans. The military are called according to the alphabet, and they, with weapons in their hands, take an oath and put their signature. From this moment on, they officially become military personnel. Daniil Ukhnalev for ArmiyaInform

Title: Preparation of the mobilized and -military rally -Paris — Dakar--: the chief sergeant of the Armed F...
Description: — What are the features of training in wartime, in the conditions of the situation that has developed, what problems and difficulties exist? — The huge volume of personnel that needs to be trained. At the same time, the terms of such preparation are as limited as possible. Therefore, the number of those who need to be trained and the time limit: these factors definitely have a negative impact on the quality of training. Again, by the method of trial, error and testing in most NATO countries, they came up with the position that the basic general military training for those citizens who have never served before should be 3 months. This is the most optimal term to equip a serviceman with all the necessary skills and abilities. On the other hand, we understand that combat units and units need to be equipped as soon as possible, given the losses they suffer on the battlefield. And here two important factors come into conflict. The first is preparation speed and quantity, and the second is quality. And it is in wartime that we try to balance these three indicators so that in a short time it is possible to train a certain number of servicemen, but at the same time achieve a certain quality of training. Of course, quality suffers. In addition, everything depends very much on how training is organized in a particular training center. How staffed are the instructors at this center and how qualified are they? Plus, it is necessary to take into account the moral and business qualities of those who come to such training, whether they have the motivation to study or not. And a number of other factors that are reflected in different educational centers in different ways. Therefore, the quality of such training in different educational centers also differs. Where management managed to gather more trained and experienced instructors, the quality is better. Where leaders think about improving the educational process, while minimizing many distractions for cadets, such as daily uniforms, patrols, shifts, performing some work and so on, of course, the quality of training is better in such training centers. But it is different everywhere. Also among the main problems is the search and selection of qualified instructors. Since May 2022, the network of training military units and training units conducting BZVP has been significantly expanded. And a large number of new instructor positions were introduced, which must be filled with competent instructors. And it is necessary that they all have combat experience, are prepared, etc. This is very difficult to do even during two years of a great war. Next, it is necessary to send as many such instructors and sergeants as possible to the appropriate courses so that they acquire the methodology and become specialists in teaching. This is what we do, trying to do everything we can and even more. — Recently in social networks, some civilians have been spreading information about the alleged falsification of BZVP in the Armed Forces, what do you know about the above, are the facts being presented true? — Yes, there are cases when civilian bloggers or some experts quite often explain in social networks certain problems of training our military personnel, especially regarding BZVP. Indeed, there are enough problems. As I have already said, you can achieve quality in training only when you train the optimal number of military personnel and you have appropriate deadlines for that. Well, of course, there are other conditions: material and technical base, ammunition. So there are problems, and we know them. Even better than some experts. And we do everything to solve them. I am participating specifically in the area of ​​professional development, training of instructors from among sergeants. It must be said here that combat sergeants are also lacking in combat military units that directly fight the enemy at the front. Therefore, commanders do not really want to give their experienced subordinates as instructors to training centers. They need them there to carry out combat missions. Another of the main problems of the basic training of a soldier is the violation of the very technology of training a fighter to participate in combat operations in the fiercest war that can be on this planet. A full-scale war of the Russian Federation against Ukraine with the use of strategic aviation and all types of weapons and equipment, including the latest drones and so on. Humanity has practically never seen such a war. Only nuclear weapons are not used. Ideally, after basic general military training, a serviceman should get into his unit, where he must undergo further training, certain exercises and a stage of collective training of the unit before performing combat tasks. It is this process that helps a serviceman to prepare for combat operations over a certain period of time. But quite often this does not happen. We can compare the participation of Ukrainian servicemen in combat operations on the front line with the participation of car racers in extremely difficult and fierce rallies -Paris - Dakar- or -Le Mans-. Professional drivers have been preparing for these races for years. Our military does not have the ability to prepare for war for years. Most of our soldiers go to combat brigades immediately after the end of the BZVP. At the moment, unfortunately, we do not have a set of military units to fully replace units on the battle line, given the large length of the entire front. This would provide an opportunity for our units and units to periodically leave the areas of hostilities, recover, and undergo a full cycle of training. Therefore, the absence of this cycle, let's say, also greatly affects the quality of a soldier's training. Therefore, it is impossible to expect that after BZVP a soldier, who was a civilian before that, will come and fully fight the enemy on the front line alongside experienced fighters. To make up for certain shortcomings in his training, as well as in psychological readiness for combat, it is necessary to train with a military unit, for which an adaptation course should be held in it for two to three weeks. I recently worked in the Zaporizhia and Kherson directions, before that I worked in other areas of hostilities. So, in each military unit, sergeants and officers organized additional training for servicemen who come from training centers after the BZVP. And where it is organized effectively, the level of execution of combat missions is better, and there are fewer losses. As part of this training, sergeants who have combat experience and an understanding of the nature of combat operations in this area identify the shortcomings of a particular serviceman, and take such additional training into account. Soldiers are trained for those types of weapons that are specifically in a brigade or battalion. Due to the fact that our units sometimes have different types of weapons (in particular, even small arms), accordingly, the nature of hostilities in different areas of the front differs. Tactics of actions of both the enemy and ours in urban areas, plantations, fields, ruins of cities and villages are taken into account. The main thing is that motivated people come who are ready to fight the enemy, protect their families, homes, their country, the future of their children. — What real steps are being taken to increase the effectiveness of the BZVP, to ensure a higher quality of training for our soldiers? — First, the quality of such training is constantly being analyzed. This is work directly in the training units and units that carry out the BZVP, by checking the training process, interviewing the military themselves, and testing them. And work in combat military units when such fighters come. At the moment, a feedback system is being implemented between training centers and units at the front: reports with shortcomings are sent for further rapid response. Secondly, we are currently working on involving officers and sergeants with combat experience from combat military units to the basic general military training held in training centers. That they directly participate in the training of their future fighters. Such a practice is already in place at the Training Center of the State Academy of Medical Sciences, and it has proven its effectiveness. The main area on which we concentrate is improving the training of the instructors themselves, in particular the professional component of their training, improving their skills in fire, tactical and engineering training, for their transfer to cadets. We hope that the increase of BZVP from one month to one and a half will increase its quality, provide an opportunity to conduct more practical training with recruits, primarily in shooting and tactics.

Title: Or maybe for a sex shop - Russian propagandists invented a TCC costume for Halloween
Description: A screenshot of this announcement was shared by z-channels in Telegram. Like, this is the -scariest- outfit for such a holiday. For -confirmation-, the fakers shared a screenshot of an announcement from the OLX platform, which was allegedly published by a user under the nickname Ihor UA. In fact, the user under the nickname Ihor UA did not display goods with such a description. The screenshot circulated online is a fake. Ukrinform investigators established that fakers changed the date and description of the original ad, in which the user sells an assault tactical suit, but leaves out the location, price, and author's nickname. With the help of such fakes, propagandists try to demonize representatives of the TCC and SP in the eyes of Ukrainians.

Title: President: North Korean soldiers are already near the Ukrainian border
Description: About this he said during the evening address. North Korea recently test-fired a new ballistic missile that set records for flight time and altitude. Volodymyr Zelensky emphasized that cooperation between Moscow and Pyongyang has already allowed North Korea to improve its missile and artillery capabilities. Now the first thousands of North Korean soldiers are near the Ukrainian border, and, unfortunately, Ukraine will be forced to defend itself against new invaders. The president emphasized that the world cannot simply watch this threat grow. According to him, Ukraine has accurate data on the locations of the North Korean military on the territory of Russia, but it cannot carry out pre-emptive strikes due to the lack of long-range weapons. The provision of such weapons depends on Ukraine's partners - the USA, Great Britain, Germany and other states, which have so far refrained from active actions. Zelensky called for the active participation not only of Western countries, but and China, which declares its desire to end the war, but at the same time only observes the situation. The President of Ukraine concluded that North Korea's participation in the war against Ukraine poses a threat to the whole world, and it must be stopped as soon as possible. As reported by ArmyInform, in an interview with South Korean TV channel KBS Volodymyr Zelenskyi shared his thoughts on the danger posed by the involvement of the North Korean military not only for Ukraine, and why it is important to resist it together.

Title: -Box- to hell - the Russian armored vehicle burned together with the landing party
Description: The video of the battle was released on November 1 by the Luhansk operational-tactical group. In the Siversk direction, the occupiers tried to attack our positions with the help of armored vehicles. One of the armored vehicles with the landing party was hit by our kamikaze copter, which was not hindered by powerful anti-drone protection. When the armored car caught fire, the paratroopers tried to escape, but were destroyed, both by FPV drones and drops. -The disposal plan for the occupiers is being carried out by the 10th Mountain Assault Brigade,- commented the video at the -Luhansk- OTU. As reported by ArmyInform, soldiers of the 10th mountain assault brigade -Edelweiss- set fire to a warehouse with ammunition of the Russian invaders.

Title: -I couldn't sit on the sidelines- - a Canadian woman fights on a tank in the Sicheslav Brigade
Description: The video about Britney was released on November 1 on the brigade's channel. Britney served in the position of commander of the Leopard crew. Brittney is currently in the position of a gunner, but plans to learn and learn from her sisters in order to fight more effectively against our common enemy. -I have five years of professional military training and I realized that here I can use it much more effectively than in Canada, where peace and my knowledge are not used,- says Britney. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 25th Sicheslav Airborne Brigade removed the road near our positions strewn with bodies of Russian attack aircraft.

Title: The Commander of the TrO Forces can now dissolve the DFTG
Description: About this reported on November 1 by the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. The Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine adopted the relevant changes to the Regulations on the Voluntary Formation of Territorial Communities. According to the document, the Commander of the TrO Forces can make a decision to disband the voluntary formation in case of non-fulfillment or improper fulfillment of territorial defense tasks. The basis for such a decision is a report or message from an official of the Armed Forces or a statement from the formation commander. Also, the updated Regulation specifies that the commander of the DFTG can submit an application for disbanding only in the event of the impossibility of ensuring the holding of authorized meetings of the formation. When the unit is disbanded, contracts with volunteers are automatically terminated, and their certificates are transferred to the local self-government body for further destruction. Changes have been made to the Regulation on the voluntary formation of territorial communities, approved by the Resolution of the Cabinet of Ministers of December 29, 2021 No. 1449. As reported by ArmyInform, according to the Resolution of the Cabinet of Ministers, military units received the right to mobilize reservists and conscripts who voluntarily wish to serve during mobilization.

Title: Hunting for fire groups: a Kharkiv man collected military secrets for the enemy
Description: The Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office informs about this. An indictment was sent to the court under Part 2 of Article 114-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine - dissemination of information on the movement and location of the Armed Forces of Ukraine under martial law. According to the investigation, since April of this year, the accused has been collecting data on the deployment of Ukrainian military units and the routes of mobile anti-aircraft fire groups in Kharkiv. To collect information more accurately, he used a monocular and a mini video camera. The man transmitted the data via text messages, attaching images of marked maps. During the search of his apartment, a mobile phone with evidence of illegal activity was found. The detainee is being held in custody until the trial, which will take place in the Chervonozavod District Court of Kharkiv. He faces up to eight years in prison. As reported by ArmyInform, detained and -u-vymaganni-groshej-z-veterana/->a doctor of the KNP -St. Michael's Clinical Hospital of Kyiv- and a military serviceman were informed of the suspicion of aiding and abetting in receiving an illegal benefit, according to a prior conspiracy by a group of persons, combined with the extortion of an illegal benefit .

Title: Modern cyber technologies for young people in defense of democracies: an international conference wa...
Description: The event was organized by the non-governmental organization -International Academy of Geoinformatics- with the assistance of the Department of International Defense Cooperation of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine and with the participation of the Kyiv Association of Military Attachés of the countries of the Ramstein group. The President of NAPNU, the head of the -Knowledge- Society of Ukraine, Vasyl Kremin, and the director of the NATO Documentation and Information Center in Ukraine, Vineta Kleine, addressed the conference participants with a welcome speech. -99% of all military aid to Ukraine comes from NATO. We all remember how we started. We started with light equipment, then added heavy military equipment, then anti-tank and anti-aircraft systems. Then drones, ammunition and tanks. And we have already reached the Patriot, IRIS-T and F-16 aircraft systems. We always emphasize that supporting Ukraine is not so much charity as our security interests. It is important to emphasize that during the last summit it was once again confirmed that Ukraine's membership in NATO is irreversible, and the question is no longer whether Ukraine will join NATO, but when. But for now, it's about increased military support and more security deals. And all this can become a bridge to Ukraine's full membership,- Vineta Kleine emphasized in her speech. ArcGIS technology, the core of NATO's geographic information system, was the subject of a 20-minute talk by Nick Sutherland, Executive Director of Defense and Intelligence at Esri European National Government Team. Col. Serhii Pryshchepa, representative of the Support Forces Command of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, told about the implementation of the tasks of creating geospatial data based on Esri technologies. The speech of the deputy chief for educational work of Lviv Lyceum named after Heroes of Krut, lieutenant colonel Taras Hrytsevich, was also interesting. Candidate of technical sciences Ivan Galenko, vice president of the International Academy of Geoinformatics, told about the command and staff game -Cyberjura-, which allows you to use cloud technologies to arrange the ArcGIS OnLine space. Other speakers also spoke about its practical application. The main target audience of the event was young people who are able to respond to the challenges of modern war with the help of modern technologies. The listeners of the online Conference were more than 300 registered participants, mostly from schools and military lyceums. Photo of the author

Title: The enemy once again shelled Nikopolshchyna
Description: About this informs the head of Dnipropetrovsk OVA Serhiy Lysak. The communities of Nikopol, Myrivska, Pokrovska and Marganetska were under the attack of the enemy. The aggressor used kamikaze drones, Grad anti-aircraft guns and heavy artillery. A private house, an outbuilding and a power line were damaged. The aggressor targeted the Zelenodol community in Kryvorizhzhia with a drone. There were no casualties or injuries in both districts. We remind you that the Kremlin strengthens anti-migrant policy - this will have a negative impact on the economy of the Russian Federation.

Title: Missiles, shells and Stryker armored personnel carriers — the USA announced another aid package to U...
Description: This was announced by known on November 1. The package included ammunition for NASAMS air defense systems, ammunition for HIMARS systems, 155mm and 105mm artillery shells, TOW ATGM missiles, medical equipment, spare parts, support systems, anti-tank weapons, missiles and more, as well as Stryker APCs. The quantity of what will be supplied is not specified in the message of the US Ministry of Defense. Military analyst Colby Badhwar claims that the US may transfer up to two hundred Strykers to Ukraine. As reported by ArmyInform, 350 horsepower and over 100 km per hour - our paratroopers told about the American Stryker armored personnel carrier.

Title: Russia is removed from participation in the cross-border payments project -mBridge- due to sanctions
Description: About this informs Foreign Intelligence Service of Ukraine. The project was developed by the central banks of Hong Kong, China, Thailand and the UAE with the support of the Bank for International Settlements (BIS, which unites the central banks of 60 countries of the world). The purpose of the discussion is to prevent the creation of an alternative mechanism for international transactions, as this will weaken the effectiveness of sanctions pressure on the Russian Federation. In view of the risks of participation in the project of Russia or the transfer of this technology to it, the Bank for International Settlements is considering the possibility of closing the project - the Director General of BIS A. Karstens stated that the organization will not support projects related to countries under sanctions. Earlier ArmyInform reported that the enemy is planting drugs in order to create a pretext for detaining Ukrainians at the TOT.

Title: the kremlin is strengthening its anti-immigrant policy - this will have a negative impact on the Rus...
Description: About this notifies the Foreign Intelligence Service of Ukraine. They provide for classifying the organization of illegal migration as a particularly serious crime, making decisions on the administrative -deportation- of foreigners without a trial, and creating a -register of controlled persons - foreigners- who are illegally staying on the territory of the Russian Federation. Strengthening the anti-migrant policy will have a negative impact on the Russian economy - migrants provide cheap labor in construction, agriculture, transport, service, etc. A decrease in their number will lead to an increase in the labor shortage, an increase in labor costs and a slowdown in economic growth. In addition, such a policy will worsen the Russian Federation's relations with the countries of Central Asia. Since the beginning of the year, the number of illegal migrants in Russia has increased by 40 percent. The rate of cases of organizing illegal migration increased by 5.5 times. In 2024, the number of decisions of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Russian Federation to restrict foreigners from entering Russia increased by 50% to 180,000 cases. Over 106,000 violations in the field of migration legislation were recorded in ten months of this year. 20,000 people were deported from the Russian Federation, and 1,200 people were deprived of their Russian citizenship. As of October 1, 6.2 million foreigners were registered in Russia (8.5 million in 2023). At the same time, the population in Russia is rapidly decreasing. This is influenced by the declining birth rate, high mortality of young men and the outflow of citizens abroad. To maintain the population at the level of 146 million people, Russia must attract from 390 thousand to 1.1 million migrants annually. North Korean military personnel are not classified as migrants. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that 84,000 Kadyriv residents plan to die in Ukraine in the near future.

Title: -Maybe I'll look better?- - Russian prisoners say that they are ready to fight with the Russian Fede...
Description: The video of the conversation with the Russians was released on November 1 on the brigade's channel. The prisoners were captured during a counterattack operation conducted by fighters of the 2nd assault battalion of the brigade in the Kharkiv region. -How on the third year of a full-scale invasion, the Russians are still playing 'we didn't know where we were going' - rate from 1 to 10 in the comments,- commented the video in the brigade. As reported by ArmyInform, the soldiers of the Third Assault Brigade conducted successful counterattacks against enemy positions in the Kharkiv region and captured 5 Russians.

Title: The ghost of North Koreans: who dies in Kurshchyna in Russian -meat-attacks
Description: Vadim Mysnyk, the spokesman of OTU -Siversk-, told about this on the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyni- . — The Defense Forces of Ukraine continue the Kursk operation. Here is the greatest enemy concentration of both [enemy] shelling and enemy manpower and equipment, he said. —The enemy is concentrating its forces precisely in this area of ​​the Kursk region, where the zone of active hostilities is taking place. The concentration of Russian forces and resources in the Kursk region is 4-5 times greater than the concentration of enemy troops in other areas in the area of ​​responsibility of the Seversk military complex. — the Russians use the tactics of meat assaults. They do not change anything - this is how they operate in Ukraine, in the Donbass and in the South, the spokesman said. The military armies of the Russian Federation are able to try to advance only by creating a significant advantage in manpower and partly in equipment. At the same time, when the Defense Forces of Ukraine destroy all enemy equipment, the Russians continue to storm continuously with small infantry groups. — Weather conditions still allow the use of equipment. But when we knock out the equipment, they continue to assault already small small groups of infantry of several people. Incessantly, literally every 10-15 minutes, they come and go, said Vadym Mysnyk. the Russians attack despite colossal losses. The military told which reinforcements the enemy sent to Kurshchyna. — There are marine brigades, and amphibious divisions, and various -storm- battalions. They are trying to carry out assault actions from different directions, but they are getting in the teeth and we are inflicting maximum damage on them, the officer said. At the same time, Ukrainian defenders do not record the participation of servicemen from North Korea in combat operations in Kurshchyna. The spokesman of OTU -Siversk- promised to provide relevant information as soon as the participation of soldiers from the DPRK in battles on the territory of the Kursk region is recorded. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that ->in Kurshchyna, Russian soldiers are wild with fear.

Title: Top ten border fighters: which units of the DPSU have the right to independently recruit new recruit...
Description: List of units and contact numbers published on the official website of the State Border Service of Ukraine. The commanders of these units can draft reservists and conscripts who have expressed a desire to do military service during mobilization. The Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine recently introduced relevant changes to the Procedure for the Conscription of Citizens for Military Service During Mobilization for a Special Period (Resolution of the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine dated October 1, 2024 No. 1130 -On Amendments to the Procedure for Conscription of Citizens for Military Service During Mobilization, for a special period-). According to the changes, the list of military units whose commanders draft reservists (except for reservists who have signed a contract to serve in the military reserve) and conscripts during mobilization is determined by the General Staff of the Armed Forces for a special period. The commander of the military unit can now independently refer conscripts and reservists to the Military Medical Commission (MMC) to determine their suitability for military service. Commanders of military units are also given the right to equip combat military units at the expense of volunteers who express a desire to serve under the draft. For this, it was necessary to contact the TCC and the joint venture. How does it work? The commander of a military unit during the draft of a conscript (reservist) for military service on mobilization: After being enrolled in the lists of a military unit, servicemen are sent to educational institutions for basic general military training State Border Service. If a person does not meet the requirements due to health or professional-psychological characteristics, the commander has the right to deny him the prize. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that the military can select units for service without the participation of the TCC. Also, ArmyInform reminds you of the opportunity to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces and recruiting centers.

Title: The path to correction — former prisoners captured one and a half dozen occupiers in Vovchansk
Description: The video of the combat operation was released on November 1. At first, the positions of the Russians were heavily shelled, then Shkval fighters advanced towards them and carried out a sweep, during which one invader was killed and 15 more were captured. After that, they were escorted to our rear, where the Russians replenished the exchange fund. As reported by ArmyInform, former prisoners protect Ukraine in the Kharkiv direction.

Title: The enemy plants drugs to create an excuse to detain Ukrainians at the TOT
Description: About this reports Center of National Resistance. According to local reports, there have been more frequent cases when detainees are charged with drug crimes as part of -counter-subversive measures-. In this way, the enemy is trying to hide the scale of repression on the peninsula. At the same time, detainees are not given the right to a lawyer and relatives are not informed of the whereabouts of the detainee. Consideration of the preventive measure takes place without closed doors. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that The General Staff of the Armed Forces named three directions where the enemy attacks the most.

Title: To finish off the missing - our sniper shot the remnants of the landing force from the damaged armor...
Description: The video of the fight appeared on November 1 on the unit's channel. Armored vehicles of the occupiers tried to land on our positions, but were defeated. Russian attack aircraft tried to lie down near the burning equipment, thus doing our sniper a favor. He knocked out the invaders one by one, as if in a shooting range. For the second assault, these Russians will go further. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the UA_REG TEAM unit of the Special Operations Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine hit by 2 enemy long-range howitzers -msta-b-, which were hitting our positions.

Title: UAVs and drones on optical fiber — the Ministry of Defense identified the main challenges for -Onsla...
Description: About this the Ministry of Defense announced on November 1. -Our second large-scale Hackathon is designed to unite talents to create the latest technological solutions that will help counter the enemy's means and save the lives of our military. We will turn the best ideas into real systems that will strengthen the country's defense,- said Deputy Minister of Defense for Digitalization Kateryna Chernogorenko. -Onslaught of Machines 2.0- will focus on two challenges: Challenge 1: Countering guided aerial bombs. The enemy actively uses corrected air bombs for devastating strikes from long distances. Due to their protected navigation and complex flight paths, they are difficult to intercept with traditional air defense systems. The Ministry of Defense is looking for solutions to neutralize or reduce the effectiveness of these bombs. Challenge 2: Countering fiber-optic guided drones. The enemy uses drones controlled via fiber optic communication. This makes their radio jamming impossible. The Ministry of Defense is looking for a solution to effectively neutralize these drones. You can register for the Hackathon at the link. Deadline for filling out the form: November 8. - After registration, we will inform participants about the technical details of the calls. The Defense Forces need your decisions!,- the Ministry of Defense said in a statement. As reported by ArmyInform, more than 200 participants attended a meeting dedicated to increasing the accuracy of the Defense Forces.

Title: -Beha- cleans the Russians, the occupier dies in agony, minus two BUKs: stream from the front-line c...
Description: The occupier learned the Russian method - -how to escape from reset-, but died. Seeing our drone, he started to roll from side to side to avoid being reset, but lost the game all the same. Having received numerous injuries, the Russian died in agony. Another Russian decided to celebrate Halloween in a special way, he chose a bag as a costume. Since the occupier was having fun in the field alone, the pilots of the BBS 63 brigade came to his party with a gift. These and other topics are discussed by our presenters - Major Andriy Makarenko and Captain Artem Golub.

Title: They don't have armor, or they hide it: in the Kharkiv region, enemy infantrymen justify their name
Description: The reasons for such a structure of losses of the enemy's ATS in the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyni- explained the spokesman of the Kharkiv OTU lieutenant colonel Yevgeny Romanov. - What we give in our reports, what we observe, what we work on is about one and a half hundred dead and wounded every day. Armored combat vehicles and tanks are also being destroyed, he said. At the same time, in terms of losses of weapons and enemy equipment, the enemy's road transport prevails. — About three or four times more equipment losses are caused by motor vehicles. They save armor, or they run out of it and can't replenish their resources in time - craft them or restore them, the spokesman explained. In view of the lack or insufficient amount of armored vehicles, the enemy command tries to preserve them and throws Russian soldiers into battle on maneuverable, but virtually defenseless, vehicles. Or at all forces enemy infantry to attack exclusively on foot. — They use either automobile equipment or send personnel on foot to the attack, Yevhenii Romanov said. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in the north of Kharkiv region, the Russians attack on everything that has wheels, but for their equipment and infantry it is a road at one end.

Title: 84,000 Kadyriv residents plan to die in Ukraine in the near future
Description: informs about this Center of National Resistance. That is, he managed to attract this number of terrorists -voluntarily- and that people should be grateful to him for this. However, Moscow cannot cope with the situation, the war it unleashed drags on, and there is a shortage of -cannon fodder-. Therefore, the puppet regime will even more actively try to use every opportunity to send Chechens and representatives of other national minorities of the Russian Federation to the front, serving the schizophrenic ideas of Putin and his entourage. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that HIMARS hit in a truck with Russians.

Title: A long-range Russian self-propelled gun was able to shoot down a Ukrainian drone! But there is a nua...
Description: The video of the lesion appeared on the group's channel on November 1. In the Kupyansk direction, the Russians hit Russian armored vehicles, Msta-S self-propelled guns and Kamaz. The latter caught fire very well and burned together with the entire load. As reported by ArmyInform, the aerial scouts of the 14th mechanized brigade named after Prince Roman the Great were able to hit the mortar position, which the Russians disguised under a pile of garbage.

Title: The state rear operator will announce purchases in all areas for 2025 by the end of December
Description: About this reported on November 1 by the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. Advance planning and preparation will ensure uninterrupted supply of food, equipment, and fuel and lubricants for military personnel throughout the year. And for suppliers — to plan and organize production processes more harmoniously. -Early announcement of purchases for 2025 is an important step for effective planning, which contributes to providing the Armed Forces with everything they need. This approach allows suppliers to prepare for participation in tenders in a timely manner and contributes to the transparency of the procurement process. Working on forecasted planning, we strive to increase the level of provision, eliminate the risks of supply disruptions and ensure the effective use of state resources,- emphasized Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine Dmytro Klimenkov. -Planning purchases for the whole year was a challenge for us. And this is one of the main goals we set for ourselves in the first year of work. We managed to do this thanks to the joint work of the DOT, the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine and the structures of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. This synergy made it possible to qualitatively change the approach to uninterrupted and timely provision of the military. I am convinced that this will help both suppliers, who will be able to plan their activities and capacity loading, and the Armed Forces, because they will be able to focus on their main mission,- said DOT General Director Arsen Zhumadilov. In order to improve interaction with potential suppliers and manufacturers, the DOT together with the Main Directorate for the Development of Material Support held a presentation of plans for the purchase of tangible property for the next year. The market was informed about the changes in contracting conditions and qualification requirements. Also for manufacturers of tangible property, the State operator of the rear will provide training to suppliers on the preparation of documents for participation in procurement. A number of changes are foreseen in the direction of nutrition for 2025. In particular, it is planned to launch a pilot project of a new supply model for 5 regions with the direct involvement of manufacturers. In addition, product quality control will be strengthened - for this purpose, requirements for their energy value will be revised. It is also planned to involve the State Production Service in scheduled and unscheduled inspections of manufacturers and suppliers. In addition, digitalization of processes will continue, in particular, DOT-Chain will provide for the creation and processing of acts of violation of contractual obligations. And for canned products, automated control of the quantity of shipped products will be implemented. Also in the area of ​​food for 2025, DOT plans to approve and purchase new inclusive dry rations that will include the ethical, medical and religious needs of the military. Currently, technical specifications for halal rations have been approved, and technical requirements for kosher and plant-based ones are being developed. , in particular according to the NATO codification. This applies to light petroleum products as well as lubricants, oils and liquids. As reported by ArmyInform, a quarter of the Armed Forces support the introduction of inclusive suhpajkiv.

Title: - gazelle- kobzon — HIMARS hit a truck with Russians
Description: The video of the damage appeared on November 1 on the brigade's page. Our pilots allowed the HIMARS jet system and 155-caliber artillery (high-explosive and cluster shells) to work against the enemy. After that, the occupiers had to load corpses and wounded into the surviving Gazelle. -The result was a direct hit to one of the trucks and up to 10 confirmed wounded and killed among the personnel of the occupiers. The hunt continues...-, the brigade commented on the video. As reported by ArmyInform, the pilots of the -SkyForce- group of the 108th separate brigade of the Forces of the Territorial Defense of the Armed Forces recently successfully fried the Strela air defense system -10- occupants.

Title: The General Staff of the Armed Forces named three directions where the enemy attacks the most
Description: Operational information as of 16:00 on November 1 was published by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The border areas of Sumy Oblast continue to suffer from Russian airstrikes. In particular, the terrorists hit the areas of Krasnopill, Velikay Pisarivka, Zhuravka with guided aerial bombs, dropping eight anti-aircraft missiles. A number of settlements in the Sumy and Kharkiv regions were hit by artillery shelling of the terrorist army today, including Verkhnia Pozhnya, Timofiivka, Pavlivka, Rogizne, Novenke, Basivka and Pokrovka. The enemy also carried out 22 airstrikes, using 27 anti-aircraft missiles on the territory of the Kursk region of the Russian Federation. In the Kharkiv direction, the occupiers dropped two aerial bombs in the Dergachi district. In the Kupyansk direction, the enemy tried twice during the day to advance to our positions in the areas of Petropavlivka and Lozova. A battle is going on near Lozova. The aggressor increased the number of attacks to 12 in the Lyman direction. Attacked in the vicinity of Druzhelyubivka, Katerynivka, Grekivka, Makiivka, Terni and in Serebryansk Forest. Four clashes are currently ongoing. In the Kramatorsk direction, our defenders repelled one attack by the occupiers near Stupochy. In the direction of Toretsk, the enemy did not carry out offensive operations, but carried out airstrikes in the areas of the settlements of Toretsk, Petrivka and Kostyantynivka, dropping eight anti-aircraft guns. Enemy activity currently persists in the Pokrovsky direction. Clashes of varying intensity have started here 21 times today. Attacks were repulsed in the areas of Sukhoi Balka, Myrolyubivka, Mykolaivka, Lysivka, Krutoy Yar, Novogrodivka, and Selidovo. Currently, two battles are still going on in the Vyshnevo region. Fighting continues in the Kurakhiv direction. During the day, 24 combat clashes took place near Ostrivskyi, Illinka, Novoselidivka, Kreminnaya Balka, Novodmytrivka, Vovchenka, Maksimilianivka, Dalnyi, Antonivka, and Katerynivka, and 13 attacks by the occupiers are ongoing. In the Vremivsk direction, the aggressor once attacked the positions of our defenders in the Trudovoy area. The occupiers did not carry out offensive actions in the Orihiv direction, but they carried out an airstrike with ten anti-aircraft missiles on Novoandriivka. In the Dnieper direction, the operational situation has not changed significantly. The enemy conducted three unsuccessful assaults. There were no significant changes in the situation in the rest of the directions. -Ukrainian troops are controlling the situation and exhausting the enemy along the entire line of combat engagement and in the rear,- the General Staff said in a statement. As reported by ArmyInform, almost 1,500 infantrymen, dozens of BBMs and art systems: General Staff of the Armed Forces made public the losses of rf.

Title: -They are burning, burning, tearing them to pieces-: heavy fighting continues on the approaches to K...
Description: About this on the air -Social News- told acting. press officer of the 33rd separate mechanized brigade, Nazar Voytenkov. However, according to Voytenkov, it will not be easy for the Russians to break into the city of Kurakhove. It has prepared for defensive operations and there are enough fortifications. -It is obvious that the Russians have a great advantage in terms of manpower and equipment. But we are already trained in combat — we destroy strongholds and enemy equipment. They are burning, they are burning, they are being torn to pieces,- stated the acting director. press officer of the 33rd separate mechanized brigade. Earlier ArmyInform told , that if earlier the invaders stormed in the front and lost a lot of manpower, now they focused on other tactics.

Title: At the age of 23, he defended Mariupol: the story of a defender returned from captivity
Description: The story of the fighter was made public by the Mariupol City Council. In 2022, Arthur was only 23 years old, but he bravely fought against the invaders. Together with his comrades, he defended -Azovstal-, and later was captured by the Russians. During almost three years of captivity, the defender changed 8 colonies, and on November 14, 2023 (just on his birthday) he was sentenced by the Russians to life imprisonment. From that time he was in -Black Dolphin- - one of the most terrible penal colonies of the special regime in the Orenburg region. However, on October 18, Artur was put on the lists for the exchange of prisoners and returned to his native land. Currently, the defender of Mariupol is undergoing rehabilitation. Earlier, ArmyInform reported, that more than 10 private UAV schools in Ukraine were certified in October.

Title: Sappers of the Ministry of Defense cleared more than 5,000 hectares of explosive remnants of war
Description: reports this by the Main Directorate of Mine Action of Civil Defense and Environmental Security. During the week, the sappers examined and cleared: For the efficiency of the work, special equipment for mechanized demining was involved. During this period, experts neutralized 1,618 explosive objects. In total, during the work, sappers of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine removed and destroyed 411,225 explosive remnants of war. As reported by ArmyInform, military ecologists together with civilian colleagues -mizhnarodnyh-sudiv/->investigate environmental damage caused by Russian shelling in the Mykolaiv region.

Title: Grenade launchers, rifles and carbines: hidden secrets - dodge factories - in the Lviv region
Description: This is reported by the Security Service of Ukraine. The owner of the university and the rector's office enrolled conscripts for training, violating the established license volumes. This made it possible to issue -educator's- certificates and issue deferments from mobilization. During the searches, an anti-tank grenade launcher, rifles, carbines and about 5,000 cartridges of various calibers were found at the owner of the university. The attacker was arrested and taken into custody. He is accused of violating several articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine, in particular part 1 of Art. 114-1 (obstructing the activities of the armed forces), Part 3 of Art. 332 (illegal transportation of persons across the border), Part 3 of Art. 358 (forgery of documents) and Part 1 of Art. 366 (official forgery). ArmyInform reminds that it is better not to break the law or risk your life, but to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces and recruiting centers.

Title: A dirty ditch, a smelly basement, a tight hole: Russians choose -rat race-
Description: About this on the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyny- the spokeswoman of OTU told Luhansk- Major Anastasia Bobovnikova. According to Anastasia Bobovnikova, the tactics of such assaults are simple. One, two or three stormtroopers run from ditch to ditch, hide in basements, holes and destroyed houses. -The goal of such actions is to accumulate as much as possible before the assault actions. Such attempts are detected, in particular, by our drones and are affected as soon as possible,- said the spokeswoman of the OTU -Luhansk-. Previously ArmyInform reported that 35 assault attempts were repulsed in the Pokrovsky direction - the enemy is trying to advance in microgroups of two or three people.

Title: Wind instrument orchestra - three and a half artillery regiments of the Russian Federation have alre...
Description: This was announced on the battalion channel by its commander, Captain Robert Brovdi. -Birds of Magyar- are famous for destroying enemy guns, piercing their barrels, after which Russian artillery turns into scrap. -150 guns are the arsenal of 3.5 separate worm artillery regiments. A little bumped. Three months already here in Donbas. Tired of that -black gold-. And the worm is incessant,- commented Robert Brovdi on the video. As reported by ArmyInform, the commander of the 414th battalion of unmanned aerial systems -Birds of Magyar- Captain Robert Brovdi laughed at the Russians, who for the twelfth time boasted about his destruction .

Title: Nothing holy - in Kyiv, a doctor and a soldier of the SZCH were detained, who are suspected of extor...
Description: This was reported on November 1 by the Special Prosecutor's Office in the field of defense of the Central region. According to the investigation, the suspects and the currently unidentified officials of the Central MSEK No. 1 of Kyiv were involved in the implementation of a criminal plan to receive an illegal benefit for the establishment of a combat veteran of the third group of disabilities for a period of 2 years, as well as for the subsequent production of all necessary medical documents for the appointment of the latter of the second group of lifelong disabilities. They noted that while the medical documents for the registration of the group will be prepared, the veteran must pay $5,000 for the previous -service-. In case of refusal, the group of disability already assigned to him will be canceled in accordance with the procedure prescribed by law. Along with this, it was previously established that the suspected serviceman voluntarily left the military unit in 2023 and is currently illegally outside its borders. The circumstances of his commission of the crime provided for in Part 5 of Art. 407 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine will be investigated during the pre-trial investigation. The suspects were detained after receiving illegal benefits in accordance with Art. 208 of the CPC of Ukraine. During an urgent search of the suspected doctor's place of residence, cash in the amount of UAH 46,000, almost $87,000, and almost 4.5 thousand euros, as well as draft records, seals of Kyiv medical institutions, and facsimiles were seized. Currently, the question of the suspect's choice of preventive measures in the form of detention is being resolved. As reported by ArmyInform, in Lviv detained an official of the regional territorial recruitment and social support center (TCC) for attempting to bribe a colleague.

Title: The enemy attacked Vovchansk and Khutory three times: a third of the occupiers' losses are irreversi...
Description: Details of the situation in the Kharkiv direction and enemy losses were informed at Kharkiv OTU. the Russian occupiers carried out 5 airstrikes using 8 air defense systems. The 41st strike was carried out by kamikaze drones. They carried out 319 shelling of the positions of defenders of Ukraine. The defense forces respond adequately to the actions of the enemy and continue to effectively destroy the manpower, weapons and military equipment of the Russian occupiers. In addition to the loss of manpower, in the Kharkiv direction, the enemy lost 83 units of weapons and military equipment destroyed and damaged, in particular: In addition, in the north of the Kharkiv region, the Defense Forces of Ukraine destroyed 53 shelters for personnel, 6 ammunition storage sites and a UAV control post. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in Kharkiv Oblast, fighters of the Third a separate assault brigade was hit by a Russian bridge-builder.

Title: October results: the Navy of the Ukrainian Armed Forces eliminated more than 2,500 Russian soldiers
Description: inform the Naval Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Estimated losses of the enemy were: The enemy continues to suffer significant losses in both personnel and equipment. The data is being verified. As reported by ArmyInform, from the beginning of the operation in the Kursk region of the Russian Federation military units and units of the Airborne Assault Troops of the Armed Forces of Ukraine inflicted losses on the enemy of almost eight thousand soldiers, which is equal to 15 enemy battalions.

Title: More than 10 private UAV schools in Ukraine were certified in October
Description: This was reported by the Deputy Prime Minister for Innovation, Development of Education, Science and Technology, Minister of Digital Transformation of Ukraine Mykhailo Fedorov. Training programs are developed based on the requirements of the Ministry of Defense, and in order to receive certification, schools must provide drones for practice and experienced instructors. The pace of private school certification remains high, and by 2025, all schools could receive the necessary permits. This opens up new opportunities for entrepreneurs and raises the standards of education in the field of UAVs, contributing to the development of the drone market in Ukraine. As ArmiyaInform reported, this year, thanks to the support of the Brave1 platform, Ukrainian developers of defense innovations attracted more than $25 million of foreign investment. This is a significant jump compared to last year, when the amount of investment was $5 million.

Title: - Is this a joke? No, the headband is red, ours. Poltyela - a Russian attack aircraft shot a video a...
Description: The video was published on November 1. In the video, a Russian attack aircraft goes with a partner to positions where there is a large amount of destroyed Russian equipment and the bodies of their fighters. Moreover, a significant part of the corpses had already been removed. The dead stormtrooper fought against Ukraine in the Avdiyiv direction, but died in Kurshchyna. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 225th assault battalion carried out a successful attack on the positions of the Russians, some of which remained there forever.

Title: In Berdychev, two men were beating out a non-existent debt from the wife of a military man
Description: This is reported by the Office of the Prosecutor General of Ukraine. According to the investigation, the suspects -extorted- a non-existent debt from the common-law wife of a serviceman of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. One of them has a criminal record for fraud and is accused of theft. In September 2024, extortionists scheduled a meeting of the victims and demanded to pay them UAH 50,000. The woman denied any debt. She was threatened with physical violence and blackmailed into disclosing confidential information. Under psychological pressure, the victim took the laptop to the pawnshop and paid part of the debt. The suspects demanded to hand over the rest of the money, and in case of contacting the law enforcement officers, they threatened with physical violence. The final deadline for the payment of funds was also established. Fearing for her life, the woman was forced to collect another amount. After receiving UAH 10,000 from the victim, both men were detained in accordance with Art. 208 of the CPC of Ukraine. They are currently being held in custody without bail. As reported by ArmyInform, the SBU detained in the Sumy region a former deputy of the Shostka City Council from the banned -Party of Regions-, who worked for the Russian FSB and helped carry out attacks on Ukrainian military and civilian objects.

Title: North Koreans will be passed off as Kalmyks, Tuvans and Buryats: it is planned to be used near Suzhi
Description: About it on the air -Public News- reported </.a. The enemy continues to assault small groups daily - they are responsible for -night bombardments-.

Title: Ukraine is increasing its defense potential: the US is investing 800 million dollars in the producti...
Description: About this happened during the negotiations of the Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine Serhiy Boyev with the American delegation. In particular, the conversation was held with the team of the US Embassy in Ukraine led by Ambassador Bridget Brink, representatives of the US Congress and the national security advisor to the leader of the Republican Party in the Senate, Robert Karem. The parties, in particular, discussed the prospects of attracting American investments in Ukrainian defense production. Serhii Boev thanked the American delegation for the decision to invest 800 million dollars in the production of Ukrainian drones. -This year, the production capabilities of our defense industry have significantly increased and have the potential for significant further growth. Investments from the USA can give a good impetus to use the opportunities of our industry,- the Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine emphasized. He also informed the partners about the situation on the battlefield and current security challenges, in particular, the enemy's engagement of troops from the DPRK. The delegation from the USA agreed that Russia's cooperation with North Korea, Iran and China poses a common threat to the interests of Ukraine and the USA. In addition, the military plans of Ukraine and the needs of Ukrainian defenders were discussed. -The Defense Forces need the help of partners in restoring our brigades, as well as in training and equipping our strategic reserve,- Serhiy Boev noted. The delegation from the USA expressed interest in borrowing the experience of Ukraine in the development of the Defense Forces in the conditions of full-scale armed aggression by Russia. As reported by ArmyInform, Ukraine and Denmark discussed key support within fighter and air defense coalitions.

Title: The enemy hit Kherson with a rocket: there are casualties
Description: informs Kherson OVA about this. It is noted that one person was injured - a 64-year-old man who was in the building at the time of the attack. -He suffered a blast injury and a shrapnel wound to his face. Medics treated him on the spot. The information is being verified,- the message says. Also, around 11:30 in Kherson, a 25-year-old girl was injured by Russian shelling. She went to the hospital with an explosion injury and a concussion. In addition, a 67-year-old man who came under enemy fire in the Central District of the city on the morning of October 30 turned to doctors today. He received a mine-explosive injury and a head injury.

Title: -Half of the drones are flying to our positions-: more and more enemy drones are being jammed by EW ...
Description: Serhiy Tsekhotskyi, officer 59, told about this on the air of -Social News-. separate motorized infantry brigade named after Yakov Handziuk. In general, according to Serhiy Tsehotskyi, war is increasingly becoming -unmanned- in nature, without human participation. This especially applies to the use and countermeasures of drones. -I will say that we deactivated 84 enemy drones during the current 24 hours only with EW means. And before that, 91 units per day. These are those that did not fly to our positions. About half of them arrive. We destroy a certain part by fire damage,- said Serhii Tsehotskyi, an officer of the 59th separate motorized infantry brigade named after Yakov Handziuk. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in the Kramatorsk direction, the enemy continues daily assaults in small groups - they respond with -night bombardments-.

Title: It was smoking, burning and flying: Oleksandr Syrskyi showed the massacre of the Russian troops
Description: He published a video of combat work on his channel. The Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces emphasized that the Russian occupiers are getting a well-deserved retribution for their crimes. As a reminder, Oleksandr Syrskyi called for an international reaction to the participation of the North Korean military in the war on the side of Russia. As reported by ArmyInform, the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces demonstrated how the occupiers-racers unsuccessfully drive into Ukrainian territory, where they are met by our fighters.
